Beautiful fit for a 32F, doesn't pull across the bust when buttoned, and wonderful colors for a red head. No back vent. Unlined but very well made- cute with jeans and flats- stretchy knit and comfortable. Reminds me of a Missoni in look and spirit. Tremendous- love it!

I loved this top, and the color has been a favorite of mine this season. My only complaint was that the top wrinkles so easy. Even just the seatbelt in the car for 20 mins. Would definitely rent again though!
This was fun, I got a lot of compliments. It was a bit short, so I wore a cami under it. It wasn't the most flattering shirt, but it was cute even with my large chest.
Another color I never thought I could wear but alas, loved this shirt. It's a bit boxy (read: comfy) so I did a French tuck and called it a day. Get it before summer ends.
Great summer top, wore tucked into high waisted jeans

This top arrived new with tags. I really liked it, but didn't think that the color was very flattering with my skin tone. I wore it anyway though and got a few compliments. It's very light and perfect for warm weather. I wore an XXS and usually wear an XS or S with most brands. However, madewell tops always seem to run large on me.
Fun too. Disappointed in the dry cleaning-the top was in no way ironed. Pretty sloppy service.
This shirt was so light & comfy! Very roomy so the medium felt a little big but not in a bad way. Would rent again but in the summer or fall.
The shirt fits well except if you have a longer torso it runs short. The color and embroidery are nice and it's lightweight and flows

I usually wear a medium but only a large was available, which was actually fine since it's meant to be loose & casual anyway. Really liked this top and got quite a few compliments when I was wearing it.
Fun top- great color
Very comfortable peasant top. Wore this top multiple times!

links_reviews_title: What you see is what you get
links_reviews_text: This is a bright, cute, wrinkly top. Easy to wear, comfortable, and I think the wrinkles are sort of part of the look so nothing to stress over. Recommend.

links_reviews_title: Easy to wear over and over
links_reviews_text: I've worn this so many times. So comfy, airy, light and love the color. Perfect for everyday wear.

This top was cute and fun for an outdoor Sunday brunch. I wore it with high-waisted jeans and tucked it in, although the shirt didn't stay fully tucked. It also got pretty wrinkled, but overall, I liked it.

links_reviews_title: Nice, light shirt for the summer time!
links_reviews_text: The color and fit were great, it was the perfect summer shirt to wear to work. The best part was something I noticed only after I wore it - there are little snaps at the shoulders that you can clip to your bra strap to make sure the neckline holds it's shape. Would definitely recommend renting this shirt before the summer is over.
Runs slightly big, I would size down from medium to small
I wore this top in my second trimester with white jeans and loved the look. The top does show it's wear-but it goes along with the feel.

This top is super cute, light weight and flowly. I order my clothes large because I'm still trying to lose some baby weight I'm pretty self conscious about but even then, I could've sized down. It runs on the shorter size but overall, I liked the color, fit and material. Guessing it will wrinkle easily though so there's that.
Really cute top but it took a while to press all the wrinkles out.
This is a great top!

I got this with the tags still on! The color didn't look that great on me but I wore it anyway. Fit was a little on the large size-- I am 5'3", 32D, and 115 lbs, and got XXS. Normally an XXS would be tight in the chest, but this wasn't.
Rent for vacation: airport: phone & passport going out: whatever you need

links_reviews_title: Goodlooking, but swiped left. Couldn't manage the essentials (phone keys wallet).
links_reviews_text: Was looking for something small and convenient to keep my hands free when I don't want to wear a conventional sized handbag. It works for my phone and cardholder, but couldn't fit my keys in there. So, it didn't work. Nice looking though, would have added a bit of something interesting to everyday wear. Wish it was just an inch bigger maybe?

links_reviews_title: Cute cross body bag. Minimal, small
links_reviews_text: Nice small cross body good for going out when you don't want to have anything other than your phone and small wallet. Light weight. Nice chain and embossed patent leather like. Very small and does not close at top.
Compliments galore! Small, but it fits the essentials: phone, tube of lipstick, a couple of cards and a few dollars.
I loved this sweater! The color was great and it was comfortable. It does run a little small so I would size up if in between sizes.
Sleeves fit perfectly. Pretty warm and thick.
Maybe I should I'm have realized this before... Love the cropped sweater idea, in concept, but as soon as it got a bit chilly my stomach and back were freezing- be prepared!

links_reviews_title: Everyone loved this piece I put together and like how the shirt looked
links_reviews_text: Super comfy and it keeps you nice and warm.
Thought I'd try out the crop. The sweater was great but way too short for me.

links_reviews_title: Definitely would rent again or buy
links_reviews_text: Soft, fits perfect, great for fall wardrobe with high waisted pant.
The material was a nice medium weight and the length was flattering. Overall comfortable and a nice color.

The color of this sweater is perfect for fall transition. It is definitely cropped. Even in my highest waist jeans (in picture) you could still see a little skin. The material is light and the sweater layers well. I rented and wore the medium, but could have done with the small (the sleeves on the medium were a little wide for me).

links_reviews_title: Didn't wear it because the material was uncomfortable.

links_reviews_text: I really like this sweater, but I would DEFINITELY buy a size up. The sweater also rides up when you are walking around so it quickly turns into a crop top.

This sweater is truly a crop top. I was hoping to wear it to work with some high-waisted pants, but it was just too much of a crop top to wear in the office. Instead I wore it out on the weekend twice as a cute/casual top. I loved the fit and the knot in the front was a simple but stylish detail. I'm about 5'3 so the shirt would probably run even shorter on a taller person.

links_reviews_title: Cute but more cropped than expected
links_reviews_text: It's warm and nice but expected it to come down a bit more than it did. Paired nicely with jeans!

I loved wearing this sweater! It was the perfect crop with some high waisted jeans. The color was so cute for this unseasonably warm winter. And it's very warm! My only qualm is that, because it's so warm, be wary of sweat stains. I didn't think with a sweater this thick that sweat would show, but it really does lol

links_reviews_title: This was so cute. Works really well with high waisted jeans. Loved it.
links_reviews_text: This was so cute. Works really well with high waisted jeans. Loved it.

links_reviews_title: The twist is weird but I still loved it!
links_reviews_text: The twist did not lay well on me, but I am small chested and suspect it might have looked better if I wasn't. I did wear it for several different fall wedding related events, two bridal showers, a rehearsal dinner, and a casual farm wedding (all different brides and groups) with a long floral skirt and got so much positive feedback. It was very comfortable and it did not come down too low on me at all. Definitely would wear again!
Didn't like how high up the crop came

I wore this with ripped light denim jeans and booties for a fall brunch with my girlfriends. I got so many compliments, it looked great with high waisted jeans. I rented the medium because the small wasn't available and it was a little big I'd say it's true to size!

links_reviews_title: Did not wear...more cropped on me than in the photo provided.
links_reviews_text: Did not wear...more cropped on me than in the photo provided. Maybe my torso is longer?

I wore this a couple times before I sent it back! It was such a cute spring jacket. The only thing wrong with it was, no pockets. I kept going to put my phone in the pockets and there weren't any. I ended up pairing it with a fanny pack

I've never received so many compliments for a sweater! This was such an interesting material - almost like netting over a warm fabric. Size up - The jacket itself runs pretty small and the sleeves were too short.

I loved this when I took it out of the bag - it's really gorgeous in person; vibrant colors, intricate netting. A super cute and feminine bomber. I felt certain I would buy it when I saw it. However, it's almost cropped. I found the length annoying and ended up only wearing it once and sent it back!

links_reviews_title: Not your Average Baby Shower outfit
links_reviews_text: I loved this jacket it was so fun! I wore it over a black dress with Red Converse for my Baby Shower. I wanted to keep my look more fun and "me" rather than your usual maternity dresses. Got so many compliments! Only down fall is the size runs a bit small. Not because I'm pregnant but the sleeves seem short too.
The fabric felt a little over worn, but this was a fun jacket. I got a couple compliments on it and it was comfortable.

I loved this bomber and am considering buying it to keep. Great fit and fully lined. It is surprisingly warm, but lightweight. I loved the beautiful detailing in the floral. Fit is nice and cropped. I was nervous the small was going to be too large, but it was perfect! I usually wear a size 0 or XXS/XS petite. I loved the fit of this jacket in the small, especially to have long sleeves on underneath. Great piece!
Fun pattern and colors, but it is much more cropped than I realized, and narrow in the shoulders.

links_reviews_title: Soooooo cute. Wore in a photo shoot and may just end up buying it.
links_reviews_text: You will love it

links_reviews_title: The piece is beautiful and photographs very well
links_reviews_text: I rent it for a trip to NYC and it was perfect for a 65F weather and for photos. The Jacket is a little warm and the colors are beautiful. However it looks worn out.
Not warm at all but so cute

I'm 5'10, 150lbs. Usually wear 27" jeans/size 4 or 6 dress and I vary in a small or medium shirt/jacket. I ordered a small and it fit.... but a medium, due to the shorter length/style, would have been a tad better. Still loved it and would rent again. It's light weight, perfect for fall.

links_reviews_title: Rough texture and sleeves are short. Good for casual... fun attire.
links_reviews_text: I am 5'8" with an athletic figure. Longer torso and long arms. The jacket fit and was cute.. but I had. A complex because the sleeves were short and the fabric was textured and not a vibrant as I had hoped for. So it could only be wore in a casual manner.
I got tons of compliments on this jacket. I wore it with both jeans and a dress. Both outfits looked great because of the cropped fit.
This jacket was so comfortable and an awesome way to spice up an otherwise plain outfit. It is lined, so I was worried it may be too hot for a warm fall day, however, it ended up being perfect.
Perfect for the hostess of a gala!
Little small, but such a fun pattern and perfect for cool nights in the Bay Area!

I liked this bomber - it has a beautiful print and generally fitted, though I found it snugish on my arms. A few cons to note - I kinda wish it were longer and it would definitely benefit from pockets. You also have to be careful with the mesh fabric - it can easily get caught on something like a stucco wall.
This can be used to dress up any outfit and is really beautifully sewn up close.
It was nice, but delicate- as its a mesh over fabric- so watch out not to snag or get catch on jewelry or zippers. I try to play with mix of patterns, thanks to RTR- i can experiment! Fits good .
I wore this to work kn Valentines day and it was perfectly festive. Tons of compliments. I normally wear large but sized down because that wasnt available. Still worked and would rent again!

links_reviews_title: easy way to make a boring outfit more fun
links_reviews_text: True to size, nice medium weight than can definitely be layered. Great color and quality!
Good bomber with pretty details. Glad I got a large, ran a little small. Liked, didn't love. Wish it had pockets!

I found the sleeve length on this jacket to be very short... or perhaps it is actually meant to be 3/4 sleeves? Anyway, its impractical for a person's arms to stick out of the jacket sleeve, so its a thumb's down from me.
This is a cool jacket and had a netting over the fabric. The lining is also very nice but it is really short. I couldn't wear it but I am long waisted.

links_reviews_title: Glorious embroidery in a memorably dark pink rose
links_reviews_text: I seriously considered purchasing this brilliant jacket
I'm 5'2 and 105lbs and this jacket fit well. I tend to like baggier jackets so I can layer things underneath but this jacket runs small and is super short so I would size up.
Cool fabric and style but very short and sleeve liner was not very comfortable/flexible. I wore it 2x but wouldn't rent again.
This is a great piece that can be dressed up or dressed down.

links_reviews_title: This was to jazz up a plain dress for an outdoor evening
links_reviews_text: It was really cute, but cut very small. I am athletic and it was very tight in the shoulders and was even more cropped than anticipated. Caution if you are both tall and athletic.

links_reviews_title: Makes a casual outfit more fun
links_reviews_text: I got lots of compliments on this fun, cropped jacket. It sounded like it ran small, so I ordered a M (I'm sometimes between sizes) and found it a little big in the shoulders and body. It doesn't have much give in the fabric so order up if you're concerned. Fit was cute and brought a bit of fun/color to black jeans/black t-shirt look.
SO small. Very cropped. Even with planning to wear it open it was comically small on me. Looked like I was wearing a middle schooler's jacket.
Was a little too short for me and my fuller bust.

links_reviews_title: Very cute jacket - perfect for layering in the Spring.
links_reviews_text: It's not meant to be full length sleeves but it's also very narrow in the arms, so you can't push the sleeves towards elbows. However, it doesn't look small - it looks tailored. Easy to snag, so beware.

I'm only 5 2 and this jacket is very cropped. Because it felt kind of short I ended up wearing the XL just for a little extra length. I wear it with just black leggings black T-shirt booties. It was super cute and definitely dressed up the outfit. Highly recommend it. Would love to buy it but not for a $300 price tag LOL
Loved it - kept it all winter. Great for going out or just as part of a casual outfit
Overall nice -- meant to be worn open and casual. Sleeves are shorter than appears in picture. Is somewhat dense, so perfect for cooler days. Travels well.

links_reviews_title: Different than what I would typically buy for myself but loved it.
links_reviews_text: This is a cute, trendy and nice pop of color track jacket. Loved it casual with jeans and a tank to dress up a bit. Great material.

links_reviews_title: You honestly can't go wrong with this jacket.
links_reviews_text: Trust me, you should rent this. Paired with a black jumpsuit for a cocktail party and it was everything. Received compliments all night.

links_reviews_title: Cute for summer but did wear
links_reviews_text: Its a crop jacket that goes just under the bra line. Its cute but not for winter
I'm 5'3 120lbs and the small fit great for a jacket. I paired it with cropped jeans, black tee and calfie boots for a casual everyday look. Very cute.
RTR suggested sizing up, but it was quite roomy -- my regular size would have been fine. Loved it anyway! Great color, interesting sleeves, nice fabric. Would rent it again.
I loved this style of blazer but it was a little large on me, especially the sleeves.
This blazer is so cute! My only complaint is that the pocket had a hole in it.
It felt like a retro blazer being revived. Shoulder pads, and tight around the wrists. Won't rent again.
Not very flattering on me. I didn't wear it. Maybe I should have sized down.

This was a lighter green and look like I just won the masters. Was not my style and would not have rented if I'd known it was much lighter in person. Overall fit was cute though with it being a little oversized
Would suggest sizing up if you want a looser fit!

I loved this top! While it may seem pretty basic I loved the unique twist on a wardrobe classic. I own a ton of stripes and this is like nothing else I own. It is definitely a boxy fit but I don't think that it made me feel like I looked larger. I was so happy with this and will be renting again.

links_reviews_title: Edgy take on a button down
links_reviews_text: Loved it. Will rent again.
Love this shirt. It's a loose fit but has shape and structure. The asymmetrical pattern is not super obvious but adds some visual interest. Would definitely rent again!
great, square fit top. compliments all around and perfect for first day at my new job + impromptu shoot at the house. buying this guy.
This shirt was shorter than I imagined, maybe because I got an xs. It wasn't something I'd usually buy but was fun and different, very airy and comfortable.

I absolutely loved this rental. I brought it on vacation and it didn't wrinkle too terribly. It's cute and boxyeasy to match with just about anything. The asymmetrical shape is adorable as well! I would definitely rent this again.
Fun top - wore on a weekend during the day. Great for warm weather

I thought this would be slim and somewhat fitted on the cropped side, and loose on the other side, but it is like a short smock. I know this too is cut so that it is oversized, but it is way larger than expected. However, this would be an excellent summer top for late stage pregnancy. I am typically a small or medium in tops, and I wish I had gone for an XS or XXS. Size down.

I loved this and luckily my office is young and informal enough that I was able to wear this to work. It's more cropped than I had thought, but I wore a white tank underneath and had no issues. Would also be really cute for brunch.

hung really weirdly on my 5'9" frame  ended up not wearing because it was too tight in the shoulders/armpits (i do have decently broad shoulders). didn't look intentionally asymmetrical and my s/o asked from a distance if i buttoned the shirt wrong. was way too baggy and short to tuck any part of it in, so it just looked bad with any skirt/pants i tried it on with. maybe would be better for someone with narrower shoulders, a smaller chest, and wider hips.
The reviews called it, but it's way too boxy for my busty self. I tried it on and it was an immediate nope. Would probably look cute on someone with a smaller chest or longer torso!
Gave it a try- was on the fence. Turned out to be really cute on. Definitely different but that's what I like.
This fit well. It is designed to be oversized and a great t-shirt alternative.

This was so, so wide and short. It could be because I got a bigger size than I am, but I found this to look ridiculous and returned it without wearing it as a result. It's a shame because it's a cute idea and the fabric was nice.
Make sure to wear high waisted jeans under this or your torso will show.
Love this top. I have a medium length torso and this was a pretty great length. The sizing was accurate and I loved the concept of a button up with a fun twist.

I was concerned by some of the reviews and was nervous it was going to make me look too boxy. But this was a really fun shirt and it wasn't too boxy. Has a nice flow to it. An easy throw on look for work & weekend.
I am short waisted and the XS was the perfect length for me. Those with longer waists might want to size up.

links_reviews_title: Easy work shirt with a catchy asymmetrical hemline.
links_reviews_text: The length is shorter, and the fit is boxy with a swinging a-line shape through the body.
Obsessed with this asymmetric crop!

links_reviews_title: A fun unique blouse that'll give you compliments all day.
links_reviews_text: Wore this out to an event with a pair of black jeans and everyone who saw me commented on how much they liked the blouse. It's a cool style and cut with one side being longer than the other - it's definitely large and billowy, size down if you don't like the oversized look, but it's super fun.
The design of this shirt is unique. Great for everyday wear. Fits perfectly.

links_reviews_title: The top is so cute thinking about buying it!
links_reviews_text: It is boxy but purposefully so. Great summer top with fun design, lightweight and you can either show some midriff or wear high waisted pants to cover up.
I loved this so much. Looks great with everything.

links_reviews_title: Fun details with subtle blue stripe
links_reviews_text: Pros: Quirky cut with a fun blue stripe, can wear with slacks or jeans Cons: First time I got this it was stained so had to send back for a new one but the next one was pristine!
I usually wear a medium, but I sized up on this top. The fabric is super soft, but wrinkles easily. I would definitely recommend!

It has a great look with the uneven hem and the stripes going different directions. It is a little boxy tho.. kinda reminds me of a maternity top... It's really cute w/ jeans. I folded up the sleeve so it looked a little better.

links_reviews_title: This shirt is so cute and comfortable! Clean, yet sassy.
links_reviews_text: Fits true to size and is perfect for casual outfits, or office-wear.
This was a fun casual too, a little bit of a boxy/baggy fit though
Easy style for those that want to be comfortable and cute.

It's fun, different, and exactly the reason I use RTR: I would never buy this but it's fun to experiment. It's definitely boxy but that's the intended look, and it's certainly not overwhelming on my small frame. Overall a really cute shirt to wear once and send back!
I wanted to buy this shirt, but it had some old makeup stains on the inside of the neckline. It was such a cute shirt with a fun cut. Great for big chests.

Runs very large! It's also quite cropped so if you're tall, it's likely to hit you quite high. I'm usually a M/L but needed a small, and being tall, couldn't make it work without an undershirt which took away from the look.

links_reviews_title: Meh - I'll try again in summer
links_reviews_text: Cute idea and comfortable, but it's still too cold outside to wear it without a sweater or jacket. The boxy fit did t let me put another layer over it without falling in a weird way, so I sent back.

I've worn a 4 in Theory before and the medium fit well, not form fitting, fit like a sheath. I wouldn't size down as it was fairly short as a work dress, was ok with tights but wouldn't be good with bare legs in my conservative office. Material is a bit thin and not lined. Comfortable but nothing too exciting, good dress for an average work day.
This dress is very short. I tried it with the gray tights, but black may have been better and not made it seem so short, visually. Anyhow ... enjoyed it!
Definitely a fitted dress!! Very stretchy and thick material but like a work-appropriate body con dress.

links_reviews_title: Very nice dress, fits me well, slightly formal looking

links_reviews_text: I rented the same style in the windowpane pattern last year and really liked it, but this one fell a little short for me (figuratively). I don't know if they updated the fit (think I may be imagining it but it may have been a tad too big in the shoulders) but overall I think I just didn't like the grey stripes. I wore it to work anyway but probably won't rent again.
Way too short to wear to work, even with flats and dark tights. (I'm 5' 2"!) Fit elsewhere was slightly large.
Yes this dress is basic in design, but the fabric has a subtle print and the stretch in it means this would be a great dress for work travel. Simple but classic.
I'm 5'8 and the Large didn't even cover my butt!

links_reviews_title: Loved it. Paired it with an orange scarf
links_reviews_text: Nothing to add.
Loved the high neck. It is slightly body con but appropriate and great length on me (I'm 5'1). I wore with tights, would be a good work dress.
It fit like a 60's style mini-dress, so I did not end up wearing it. Definitely shorter than it appears in pictures.
I rented this dress to wear at work but even wearing casually its way too short. Would probably fit someone more petite much better!

links_reviews_title: Fit just right. Fitted by appropriate for work/office
links_reviews_text: Fit well. The one I received the hem on the arm came to me in bad shape, but pushed up ok to wear
I rented for work and it was far too short. And tight. I am 5"6, usually a 0 and needed at least another two inches in length to wear this to work

links_reviews_title: A little too small but would expect that from Theory.
links_reviews_text: Theory usually runs small so was hoping for a good fit. My shoulders are too broad for dress so when I zipped up the back became too short. Super cute dress and material. Dress was too short for professional wear but cute for casual

Very simple and straightforward. Good for fall, in terms of general weight and style. Very simple. One of the sleeves had a dropped hem on mine, and at first I thought it was supposed to have an unfinished hem but it was just damaged. Nice for work, nothing overly special.
Wore with heels but wish I had some fancy sneakers to wear for work instead. But in general loved the dress :)
Fit great, very comfortable. Not tight but not too boxy. Nice material. Great for work.

links_reviews_title: Very flattering, but a little short for the office
links_reviews_text: Really liked this dress. It was a flattering subtle stripe. The panels on the side made it fit like a glove, but it was a bit short for the office. It was still warm in September so I didn't wear tights, but it would look good and make me feel more comfortable with the length. Would buy or rent again.

links_reviews_title: Too short to be work appropriate.
links_reviews_text: Rented my usual size (XS). Fit everywhere else but was much too short to be work appropriate. Returned without wearing. Might have better luck with the Small.
Length is perfect. Hit just above the knees

links_reviews_title: Didn't like the material. Too clingy, was hoping for more of a shift dress
links_reviews_text: Was hoping for a shift dress style but this was more of a clingy hugging type of dress.
Great casual dress for the office! Fits true to size. High neck line is flattering and unique.

Ok- why do more people not mention the pockets?! This has pockets! The pattern on this dress is beautiful- I couldn't get enough! I wore this WFH and it was so comfortable. The fabric is a high quality silk, but the cuffs and yolk are a thick chambray. It gave it just the right amount of structure. I was so pleased with this rental and can't wait to try again when I can actual wear it IRL.

I am not normally a fan of drop waists but this was certainly and exception. The fabric feels great, the sleeves are very well constructed, the pockets do not ruin your silhouette. The print is just so pretty. It makes a statement with minimal effort. Wore with over-the-knee boots and tights and I felt very feminine without being uncovered.

links_reviews_title: Nice winter option for growing bump
links_reviews_text: Wore this at 23 weeks. Only had to size up 1-2 sizes (usually 2-4 Tibi). It is a light silk fabric. Liked the print!
Easy way to dress up the everyday. Forgiving & flowy fit. I dressed it down with sneakers, and wore to a book signing. If this is in your heart cart, go for it!
Cute everyday dress. Wore with black stockings, black boots and funky earrings to match the print. Nailed the interview in this dress.

This dress is so versatile and great for winter. I wore it for Thanksgiving, to work and to a holiday event. The fabric is really nice and doesn't wrinkle easily. I love the detail of the thick cuffs. I'll definitely rent this again.
Wore this to both a work event and a baby shower. Bold print got lots of compliments. If I could have justified the cost of keeping it, I would have bought it.
Also wrinkles easy
Super cute and unique! Wore to work but it is definitely very versatile. Has pockets but they're not really useable. Also has small shoulder pads. Very cool!
V cool pattern and so easy to wear. Colors are neutral but it still feels unique and fun.

I did get compliments on this for the cool print, though it's a tent dress so it's not figure flattering. It also chokes you out in the neck when you sit. One big positive is versatility- I wore in late summer at an outside happy hour, but it could easily go all the way to winter with tights.

It's...fine for work. Not flattering at all, but a nice print and a cut that works for those days you're just throwing something on and getting through. There are pockets but shouldn't be, as they just bulk up the hips.
Would definitely rent again! Very chic, effortless and flattering.
I'd buy this dress if the sleeves were a bit shorter. The pattern is pretty, the dress looks great on, and it is very comfortable. And it's an all season number.
Adorable little dress, perfect for the changing weather. Super stylish. Kept for a couple of weeks and wore it a few times both at work and to dinner.
I wore a size 6 and it fit really well. The dress is very chic, I wore it for an afternoon tea and got a lot of compliments.
Received many compliments. Looks amazing with slouchy high boots. Fits true to size.
Quickly one of my favorite work rentals. Very unique and high quality piece. It maybe runs a tiny bit large, but fit me very well in the shoulders.
I really liked this dress. It doesn't have much shape but the print is pretty and it's flowy. I wouldn't recommend tights because of static
Loved the print on this dress. Made it more interesting than a basic black work dress and stylish enough to wear out to events.
The dress looked great on and I got a lot of compliments. I actually rented this for work but also wore it out. The fit and detail are funky but did it justice and I received a lot of compliments.
I usually wear a 6 and tried the 4 as it was the only size available and found that the fit was great.

Fun pattern and good color combo so you can wear black or brown shoes. I felt like it looked baggy more than a drop waist, but a belt helped give it more shape. It has pockets but I wouldn't put too much in there since it'll throw off the look. I could've sized down but worry it would've been too short with the hem/ruffle design. I did get a lot of compliments!

This dress was a bit too warm for a summer day, but luckily the color didn't give away how much I was sweating. Super comfortable, appropriate length, and true to size. Wore with nude slingback heels and felt polished but not overdressed for a work meeting. Could work during different seasons with tights, boots, etc.

links_reviews_title: Has potential BUT down feathers all wrong
links_reviews_text: All of the down or insulation or whatever you want to call it is basically at the bottom of the jacket making it VERY unflattering and not too warm. It made me look like I had one giant spare tire around my booty and frontal area. No thanks. Maybe needs a little TLC?

I took this jacket to Vermont with me and it kept me pretty warm. The only issue I had was the stuffing of the jacket kept moving so sometimes it wasn't even throughout the coat. Other than that, I loved it.
The army print is subtle and a nice touch to traditional black winter coats. Inside of the coat is a jersey material so cozy and comfortable.
I lovee the way this coat looks on the site but all of the stuffing dropped to the bottom of the coat making it not warm on top and very bulk on the bottom
Very warm but doesn't have a high neck. Wouldn't be good in windy conditions unless wearing a scarf.
Wore this several times over the holidays when I was off from work. It felt great and kept me nice and toasty.
Great coat but the feathers were all collected in one area making it gave zero fluff in places
Runs big. Great for windy / cold weather, but NOT rain- totally soft & will soak up any rain

I really wanted to love this coat but it made me look sloppy and a little masculine. It looked cute open, but when closed, it was too puffy and not streamlined enough. In NY winter I need something that can close and keep me warm and look cute and put together. I would definitely size down - that might help.

It's hard to see how rich and gorgeous this color is online but trust us all it's lovely. A deep hot coral/tangerine is how I'd describe it. That along with the drop waist and asymmetrical hem make this such a showstopper. I got tons of compliments. It was too cold to wear my coated denim but like other reviewers said it's such a good fit with leather or leather look jeans. Fabric is thin and needs a steam if you're going to wear it more than once.
So cute with faux leather leggings!!

I love the idea of this top, the feel, and even the sizing. It runs big, like a babydoll look. Very flattering if that's something you like. I love the color, it's gorgeous. If you are interested one bit, just get it, it's worth trying. I'd recommend this for casual attire up to dress casual. I put a bowtie to add some dimension along with the teal jacket. Great combo. Hope this helps!

links_reviews_title: I loved how funky this piece was and thought it was too good not to try!! I think I may buy it!!

links_reviews_text: Vibrant, stylish and comfy! It is a bright orange color. Will rent again.

I hate to return this blouse! I never would have rented this on the app but I saw it in store. It's stunning on! The color and shape are top notch. Definitely rent this one! It runs large. It I think it's supposed to be oversized. Wrinkles easily, wouldn't be great for vacation.
I'm always looking for pieces that are professional and also have personality. This completely fit the bill. Very cute and comfortable.
Great top! Bright orange and silky material - such a fun mix of tailored and funky. It's a bold look so had to get my courage up to wear it, but I feel awesome in this top

7 months pregnant and this shirt worked for me (I got a size up from my usual). It was super staticky tho which was a bit annoying cuz it kept sticking together and to me. Otherwise very pretty pop of color for my otherwise dark winter look.
Wore it to a work holiday party and it was so comfy, got tons of compliments. I usually wear a 4 top, sized down to a 2 and it was still a bit oversized but in a good way.
Great color! However, material is very thing and winkles easily. Sleeves are very long. Not a great option for vacation as you will need iron.
This top is stunning! I got the 2 and had LOTS of room, so it's safe to size down (especially since it's so long). Would love to order again!

links_reviews_title: Favorite RTR piece! Colorful, fun & unique
links_reviews_text: True to size, a little oversized
Cute but too big. Arms long.
Such a fun and unexpected too with leather leggings. Perfect for Friday in the office

links_reviews_title: This lightweight blouse is unique and looks great with leggings or skinny jeans.
links_reviews_text: The shirt is meant to be oversized, and it is. I suggest sizing down. The size 4 ran large on me and even the sleeves were long.

I was originally concerned with how much extra space there was around the middle that maybe I had received a wrong size but it fit perfect on the arms and shoulders. Definitely not form fitting in the mid section and honestly would be a great maternity top as well as every day. I'm 5'10" and the longest piece of the "tail" hit just below my knee. Not see through at all, forgiving silk in that I wore a bra with some lace and it wasn't so thin that you could see every detail.

Great top! The color is vibrant and the cut worked well with faux leather leggings and boots. Would rent again. I have broad shoulders and would normally get an 8 but sized down due to reviews. Turned out to be a good call

Rented this to wear on a transcontinental flight directly into meetings in NY. It was the perfect thing. Tag pop! Tops is loose and flowing but opaque- it didn't wrinkle too much in flight. Fabric is not stretchy but cut is very generous. Sitting for 5 hours was fine. I styled this with black leggings and nude and black flats and a red/teal/green tweed wool coat. Felt very fashionable while also comfortable.
Wore on honeymoon, daytime with boots to wine tour, evening with silver pumps to dinner.

i really loved this dress. wore it to a wedding and got a ton of compliments. the waist is nice and tight so it evens out with the volume of the sleeves. we got a few strong gusts of wind and i had to hold the skirt together, but other than that it was perfect! would definitely rent again.

I loved this dress, and I probably will rent it again. From the sleeves, to the flow of the skirt, to the fit, everything fit wonderfully and was true to size. I got so many compliments wearing this dress, and with a cropped sweater, people thought it was a skirt! Can be dressed up or down. I felt elegant instantly!

links_reviews_title: The sleeves have pretty pleated details!!! Very flattering fit!

links_reviews_text: Loved wearing this dress! I originally rented for a weekend in the south but it was way too hot for this much material so I saved it for a cooler wedding in the Midwest. The print is gorgeous and I got so many compliments all night. There were a couple snap closures that I didn't find right away so I almost wore it out with a little too much cleavage. Thankfully I found the snaps before going in public! Was modest and much more comfortable.
I really love this dress. It's so feminine and flattering. As others said, the hooks hold the wrap in place nicely. Can be dressed up for an event or down for work.
I liked this dress, wore it twice and received so many compliments. For us short girls (5'2) it's a bit long so I always wore a decent heel with it.

This dress was perfect - so easy to wear and easy to dress up and down. Wore this out for some day sight seeing and then again for work. Super cute with white sneakers. Add a Jean jacket and it's perfect for cooler nights. Yes
I was worried about the amount of ruffles but this is just a really lovely dress. Doesn't need much styling it's pretty much a whole outfit plus it has pockets
So much fun and lots of ruffles. I loved the pattern and it was a good fit

I fell in love with this maxi the second I put it on! This dress is amazing. The pattern is so pretty and the dress fits so well. I have a smaller bust but the ruffles and puff sleeves balanced out my shape.

links_reviews_title: I received a lot of compliments on this dress (wedding rehearsal and dinner)
links_reviews_text: This is a size SMALLER than I should be wearing so the chest was tight on me. The top part is ruffly and there is a hook enclosure to close up the chest that took me a while to figure out. The material is really sturdy so it really made me felt cinched in and I could have gone with the intended design but I didn't want to risk discomfort for the long day ahead of me so I went with the "open" concept. It looks great in real life and I got a lot of compliments, comments like 'elegant' and people close to me remarked on how much it must have cost me... so clearly the dress doesn't look cheap. I'm a size 16.

Really interesting structure and fit around the chest and sleeves. It's a sturdy material, pretty color and pattern. The chest has a couple clips to keep you wrapped up top although it was still a tiny bit low for my liking for work so I wore a cami underneath. It's a wrap dress so it does fly up when outside and walking around. But other than that I really loved this dress.

links_reviews_title: Nice long dress. With snap closures so not too revealing
links_reviews_text: Great for casual work or daily life. Snap closures keep everything in place. Lots of compliments. I thought it made me seem hippy but there's a lot of give in the bottom

Fit perfectly! Wasn't too low cut on my chest, though I am small chested so it may be too revealing otherwise. The puff sleeves and ruffles are so feminine and cute! definitely recommend. Wrap waist is super flattering!
Pretty dress, slimming at the waist. The front is VERY low-cut, I had to fasten with a safety-pin. 5'3" 34AA Athletic 117#

Flirty, feminine fit (with pockets!). Not only did I receive many compliments, people kept telling me I looked even taller! It's a true wrap dress so the skirt can come open with the right breeze, which is easy to avoid if needed. There's also a convenient clip on the top to keep it work appropriate. Will rent again

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous fabric, a bit too much dress
links_reviews_text: I loved this fabric. It's beautiful. The dress is lovely but it just felt a bit much of everything. Too much in the sleeve area, too much on the length. A lot of fabric to flow in the skirt. Where it didn't have enough fabric was the chest. I ended up not snapping it and wearing it more open with a tank underneath. If not, there would have been a big gap between the waist and where it hooks. I almost felt like this was a dress I wore as a kid during the 1980s. For reference, I'm 5'7" and it was long on me.
I think it worked well because I am tall? Hard to say but it is so special that I purchased it! Will include a photo next time that I wear it!
Great dress for vaycay.

links_reviews_title: This dress is so special. I should honestly have bought it.
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress to the Nutcracker and to Christmas. I got rave reviews on it. It's incredibly flattering and fun to wear. The ruffles and sleeves were the best. I loved it!

links_reviews_title: Loved it so much I bought it!
links_reviews_text: So pretty and flattering. I went ahead and purchased it. Won't be sending this one back!

So many compliments. Im not usually a ruffle person but this dress has just the right amount for a flattering neckline. Paired it with rust colored suede booties and short-waisted leather jacket. I'd rent again for sure.
I loved this dress. Quality fabric and great fit on a curvy woman. I would definitely rent again and look at other items from this brand.

links_reviews_title: I did not wear this one the bust is too revealing for work.
links_reviews_text: Well this one just fits a little weird. The chest is to revealing for a work function.

Dress fit true to size and the ruffle detail plus clasp at the neck helped to keep the neckline modest for church. I also wore this to a high tea and received tons of compliments. I have a 20 week baby bump that still fit under the dress but am pretty sure I would've worn the same size not pregnant as well.

links_reviews_title: Comfortable, flirty, want to own it!
links_reviews_text: Wrap dress makes it easy to wear and allows for sizing down if true size isn't available.

links_reviews_title: The button closure on this dress had popped off previously. So sadly, this did not work for me.
links_reviews_text: The fabric was great and so was the length. Sadly, I was not ever able to wear the dress since it arrived without the button closure strap.

links_reviews_title: The length, flow, and collar of this dress are very beautiful. It fits great, too!
links_reviews_text: The fit is perfect! The dress has an extra closure up top to make the v-neck more conservative for work. The length and flow of the dress is beautiful. I highly recommend!

I loved this dress and never wanted to return it. I rented it with no specific occasion in mind and ended up wearing it to a wedding ceremony (changed for the reception). It's too low cut for work in my opinion, and the one downside is that when windy it tended to blow open. If I had been wearing it for longer or moving more in it, I think I would have needed to safety pin the skirt portion shut.
The dress was super cute, just wasn't for me. The shoulders were a little too puffed for my liking. The dress fit very well however

links_reviews_title: Pretty dress but selves to puff for me

links_reviews_text: wear heels, looks better
Fun print, interesting shoulders.

links_reviews_title: Wore this to work. I wished I had dinner plans too, because this dress was too stunning for work!
links_reviews_text: My favorite RtR dress so far. I could not stop twirling in this dress. Loved the fabric and fit. I probably should have worn a cami because it is a little low cut in the front, but otherwise, I think this dress is perfect.
Might run a little large but has a hook at the busy and waist to keep the wrap secure. Lots of compliments and might be the best wrap dress I've ever worn.

This is a wrap-around dress with interesting detailing around the shoulders and sleeves (puff) and the neckline (a slight flounce). The puffiness of the sleeves was a challenge to pull-off. The material was also slightly scratchy (viscose) and felt too thick for the summer heat.

links_reviews_title: This dress is just a bit extra.
links_reviews_text: The puff sleeves and the ruffle neckline were more exaggerated than I was expecting, giving this a more formal feel than I had use for. I wanted to wear it to work but it just felt too dressy for every day. Sent it back.

There's a lot going on with this dress, in a good way. I liked the voluminous sleeves and the dramatic ruffles at the neck. It felt like a regular dress I'd wear to work taken up a notch. Might be overwhelming on a smaller person, Im 5'10". Appreciated the clasp at the busy, usually wrap dresses are too low cut for me but this kept it all together.

So pretty, especially with the ruffles. Although, it runs very long. I'm nearly 5'5" and it's almost to the ground. It's a wrap dress, but there are clasps at the waist and chest, which is nice. Although, even with the clasp at the chest, it's extremely lowcut. I definitely need a cami to wear it to work.
Great fit and color. I don't care for the 100% polyester in general, although the fabric is a good weight. I like the length.

I was worried about the fit of the pants based on reviews but they fit my body type beautifully. The high waist covered the tummy area, and the blue is really striking. I wore the pants to work, a Sunday BBQ, to bars for HH.... you can dress them up and down!

links_reviews_title: Fits just like MM LaFleur Foster pant
links_reviews_text: LOVE! Size up. I wear size 6 in Banana Republic but wore a size 8, and it fit like a glove. I'm hippy with a smaller waste. These fit just like the MM LaFleur Foster paint, if you're familiar with them. I wear size 8 in the Foster pant too.

links_reviews_title: Loved so much, I bought them!
links_reviews_text: The fabric on these pants is really wonderful. They are stretchy, comfortable and such a beautiful shape. I love the vibrant blue color and the high waist works particularly well on a tall frame (I have trouble finding true high waists and this one hits at a very comfy spot). If you like unique pants, definitely give these a try! Check out all of my rentals on my YouTube Channel. I also talk about RTR tips and tricks. Channel Name: Pointe Boutique

links_reviews_title: Work to Night, Day to Night
links_reviews_text: Loved these pants! There is a little give, so while it fit EXACTLY, very comfortable. Wore to work, then a cards game. A cards game then to an evening event. Dress up with blouse or down with a tank. Length also great with flats or heels!
I loved these pants. True to size. Color was fantastic. I wore with a turtleneck and pointy boots for a 70s look. I considered buying - would definitely rent again.
I loved the structure and fit. These pants are slightly tapered at the ankle and material is great quality. These made me feel great for my work day!

links_reviews_title: Really tight in the hips long on the bottoms not stretchy
links_reviews_text: I love the color however it can look very CNA scrub like. The fit didn't work for me. My hips and thighs felt like they could rip the seams if I bent down. Very tight in the crotch area. But the rest of the pants fit my legs other than the tight top area. The bottoms were more loose but very long so I had to roll them up.
These pants fit well and were comfortable. They were great to pair with booties and added a fun pop of color. I would buy these if I could!
Flattering fit although a bit tight in the waist for my straight/narrow build

Bright blue color, ankle length - a little hard to find shoes that look good with it. Especially in winter. Love the color though. Material is a little thin, need the right underwear to avoid panty lines

links_reviews_title: Nice color but not flattering on me
links_reviews_text: Nice color blue I'm petite and lengthwise they fit but the fit around the ankles made them unflattering on me

Fit was true to size, no stretch, high waist. I loved the color, didn't think they were that flattering on me, but I think high waisted tight pants just highlight my belly too much. I should have known better.

These pants are fun. They were a little big on me in the waist and crotch but worn with a fitted top that held them in worked well. I also had to roll them under at the bottom but I'm very petite so that's not surprising. They were work appropriate and a great color. High waisted - hit me right at belly button. Well made
Love the bold color. Fits perfectly.

These fit me fairly tightly, but in a good way. They had a bit of stretch and loosened up slightly over the course of the work day. These reminds me of the pants or peddle-pushers you might have seen in the 50s/60s. Can be dressed up for the office or worn more casually with a cropped t-shirt and tennis shoes.

links_reviews_title: My goodness! These pants are bloody cool. I don't want to return them
links_reviews_text: Could be a little tighter around the waist, but honestly great!
This is a true 4 and I am not. The 4 was muffin top city on me so I did not wear. My own fault for always thinking I can pull off a 4

The pants ran larger than I had hoped, but I made it work with a more form-fitting black top. There was an issue with the button closure (threads were loose) but it was an easy fix with a safety pin. The high-waist was nice and the length was slightly cropped, even on my 5'5" frame.
At 5'3", these were not cropped or ankle for me. I would have worn them with heels and hem tape but I felt the color was more for spring.

I liked the color and thought the photos online were spot on. The material feels nice, too. The fit was good through the hips and waist, but the ankle area was odd on me -- loose and sloppy looking. A slim fit everywhere but the ankles, go figure! I sent them back right away.
The color is great but they were too large for me.
I enjoyed these for work, they were cute, but I sized up and the waist was still a little snug. Fit everywhere else
Not too tight - very appropriate- lots of compliments - color is boss!
Runs TTS and the fit was fine, even on my short and curvy frame. My husband couldn't get past the color- it's a very saturated blue! Matches great with the Trina Turk Fiji top.

At first I thought these pants were nothing special except for the fun color. Then I took them on a trip to Europe, wore them twice, packed them tightly in my suitcase, then took them out and immediately took this picture - so safe to say they travel very well and don't wrinkle at all. These pants are very slim, so you will have the best success if you are very comfortable with your hips and legs or if you wear Spanx. I'd recommend sizing up.
I really wanted to love these pants. The color was bright, as expected. But entirely too small.
There was a snag on the front of the pant and the material was starting to shine. I did not wear it.
Great fit
Looked great from behind, but did make my tummy look a little bigger. Overall, cute look for work when paired with a blouse, black blazer and heels.

links_reviews_title: Amazing color; runs small, gorgeous pants.
links_reviews_text: Wish I could've worn these - will be ordering a size up. Love the color, the quality is amazing, fit is on point. Love these pants.
Kind of large in the waist and calves, but seriously so adorable!
True to size, color was bold. Lots of compliments, very comfortable.
Loved the color and fit.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful color, strange fit below the knees
links_reviews_text: These pants were fitted from waist to knee and then were a bit baggy from knees down.
Form fitting, tight waist.
Wanted this to work, but the waist was too tight, the leg was too big and the hem was too long. There was no way another size would work without alterations. Great color though.
Fit perfectly for my body shape

Great color and material. Rented these to wear to work, then changed my shirt and went out later that night. I'm in between a 0 and 2 and the zero was a liiiiiittle tight, so I'd rate them true to size. Bonus: I'm a bit pear shaped for my size and the pants hit at all the right places. Sometimes size zero has the thigh clearance of a 10 year old, but these were actually cut for a woman!
I liked these pants

The sweater fits well and isn't baggy on the torso. However, being on a petite side I've always had issues with tops, sweaters, jackets etc that are the right size (XS) but have these long sleeves! Maybe I just have short arms. My solution to this sweater's sleeves were to fold it and it looked like cuffs. Not bad, to be honest. I love the look on this chic sweater overall, nonetheless.

The small was perfectly oversized. The material is VERY thick (almost a little too warm), but it felt super high quality. My only gripe was that it was a little long, but looked cute half tucked into jeans.

Super warm and snuggly in subzero days with a bohemian skirt, tights and boots or black cords. Great pattern, if a bit too bulky to be flattering. Would have purchased at a lower price point; a classic casual look and nice color combo.
Loved this sweater! The pattern is really pretty. It's thick and warm and not scratchy
Great quality, comfy sweater. Kept me super warm! It was a little big on the shoulders and made me look bigger than I am. But, overall a great print and an easy wear for the winter.
This sweater is very warm and cozy- rented it for a December trip to Chicago, and it was perfect.
I loved this sweater. It was toasty and warm. I wore it on a very cold day while attending an out door event. It was perfect. The color of the sweater was subdued and the fit was large.

I'm into anything that is cozy in the winter and this is it. Rented it for a ski trip but wore it at home too. I'm 5 foot 8 with broad shoulders and the S fit perfect. If you want it loose, go up a size. It is not itchy at all.
Nice sweater for every day - nothing particularly great, but flattering and warm for a basic sweater.
The pattern is for real, I think it kind of overpowered me. The shoulders were too big for me, probably could have worn a small.

This sweater is fairly thick and warm. I was drawn to the interesting neckline. You don't need much jewelry to look put together. I liked the longer length. It did look like it was well-loved with some pilling. Fine sweater but doubt I'd rent again.
Soft, comfortable, true to size

It is a nice and cozy sweater but it is not as it appears in pictures. Maybe it has shrunk from too much dry cleaning, but it hits at the waist of my jeans and is banded at the bottom - does not hang loose as in photo.

links_reviews_title: This sweater is just so cute, I got compliments on it whenever I wore it. It was cozy as well.
links_reviews_text: It was a bit big, but a nice oversized fit. And because it is wool, it is definitely a little bit itchy, so if you have a wool sensitivity you may not like it. It didn't particularly bother me though.
Relatively fitted, soft yarn, good for everyday. Not especially nice quality, but totally fine to wear once or twice.
XL was too big for me. Did not wear. Ordered a L.
Looks exactly like the photos. I'm a 6/8 and the medium was perfect. Really nice and warm. I'd rent this again in the fall or winter

links_reviews_title: It's big and comfortable, cute spring sweater.
links_reviews_text: Oversized, thick, warm.
Nice fit and thick fabric
It's such a good, cozy sweater. I will say it's VERY warm so just know that.

links_reviews_title: Fun, cozy and soft and on trend
links_reviews_text: Nice basic sweater. Very soft, not scratchy at all.
Perfect for a cold weather. Super warm and not itchy.

links_reviews_title: Loved this sweater! Wore it all winter.
links_reviews_text: Very warm, cozy sweater for winter. Looks so cute with grey jeans.
Unfortunately this sweater was a bit large and worn. But I really like the pattern, I'll likely rent again in a smaller size.
I ordered because I liked the pattern but wasn't impressed by the sweater in person. It is shorter than it appears in the photo and is way too thick and not soft. Will be returning without wearing.
A little too much room for me though
Cute sweater but bulky and chunky knit
Loved this classic sweater, super fashion forward, matches with everything and wore it for work and during the day on the weekends! Also super warm!
Very comfortable and warm sweater. Perfect for dress for my day at work in January! I would definitely rent again.

links_reviews_title: Fine everyday sweater, a little too big
links_reviews_text: Rather bulky, but perfect for a cold day
Longer sweater, which is great for tall women. Not boxy!

links_reviews_title: I rented it for family holiday gatherings & it was warm.
links_reviews_text: Fit well. I bought the next size down due to previous reviews, and it worked out great!
This is lovely to wear. I'm not crazy about the color combination, but otherwise, it's great. Wore it over the Christmas holiday in New England and was always warm enough.
VERY soft sweater, perfect for casual wear with jeans or leggings. Definitely has an oversized feel as it's a thick sweater but was perfect for what I wanted
The sweater is a nice style, but bulky. It sort of rode up to become a turtleneck when you sit down, which was awkward. Colors and pattern are nice though.
Wore this on a cold snowy day and the thickness and high neck were perfect!

I loved this sweater! It's 100% wool and great quality. It definitely kept me warm in NYC this Thanksgiving. It's not meant to be form-fitting and I loved the length (just under the butt). Definitely recommend for winter.

This sweater runs slightly large. Good length for me (butt cover but does not emphasize!). I was not happy with the wool which was pilling all over so it looked almost fuzzy. Don't know if that was the style or successive wearing and dry cleaning. Not my fave. I did like how warm it was and the pink around the neck. It was just ok.
Very warm sweater for everyday. It runs a little large so size down and you'll still have a slightly oversized fit. Soft wool fabric.

links_reviews_title: Super warm, super cute for everyday wear, sweater is starting to pill
links_reviews_text: perfect fit

links_reviews_title: Runs large, hole in crotch by design
links_reviews_text: My usual work pants size was slightly loose. There is literally a hole at the bottom of the fly zipper that is not closed by zipper or clasps or buttons, it's like a wrap dress pants, if you wrap it it's not exposing underwear obviously but I was still worried. Did not wear.
The 26 fit well at my hips so I sized down so it would fit better at my waist. Light material, great for spring/summer. Still loved the 26 size pants.

These pants are beautifully made and look high quality, but they are HUGE! I'm a solid size 6, and usually wear a 28 pant, but these were so big they almost fell off of me. Sadly returned without wearing, but plan to rent again, sizing down at least 1, maybe even 2 sizes.

Saggy butt situation again w this brand. I couldn't even figure out how to button the inside button and there's a weird hold in the crotch that looks like it's part of the design to achieve the dripping bc the tags were still on the pants when I received them.
I wore these for a regular workout. I'm trying to entertain myself due this quarantine and high end athletic wear is my jazz. These were so comfortable and they stayed in place.
They were super comfy and cute. Only downside was that they run rather big so I kept having to pull them up which got annoying after a while.
Sper soft and warm. Great for winter.
These were fun leggings. I enjoyed feeling cozy and warm in them. Very comfy.

links_reviews_title: Hands down, the most comfortable pants I have ever worn!!
links_reviews_text: soft, great fit, in great condition - these are easy to dress up for a night out or to snuggle into for a night in front of the television. the fit is perfect - and I cannot say enough about the comfort - also, living in cold weather - these are very warm!! love them - may not send them back!!

I'm 15 weeks pregnant and figured these would add a slightly dressier touch than my regular yoga pants for our New Years Eve party. They were very soft and got many compliments on the look! They do run a little large, so i found myself tugging on them a bit throughout the night, but they were plenty long enough and very cozy. Would definitely rent again.
These leggings are super comfy... I wore them to work and received so many compliments on them, I REALLY was attempted to purchase them!!

links_reviews_title: Almost returned these, but glad I gave them a chance.
links_reviews_text: These fit true to size, but I am between a medium and large. When I tried them on, I felt like I might need to size down to medium, but decided to keep the large. They are so comfortable and cozy. I wore them several times during the month, including on Thanksgiving. Definitely able to be dressed up or down. I would consider renting these again.

I wore this once to work and once out. It was so comfy. I'll be honest I rented mostly because I wanted to say I'd worn a $1000 shirt but it ended up being an adorable rental, the silk felt great and the oversized pj look worked well with both work pants or jeans=
Loved the fun pattern, definitely an accent piece. May have ordered too big of a size.

Loved this top! So easy to wear on the weekend or to work. Can be dressed up or down. It runs large, and I could've worn a smaller size. But I love the oversized look so I think it worked fine. Would rent again!
Loved this top! It was so beautifully made, and a really special unique print. Lots of compliments! It definitely runs big, but you can tuck it in or tie it and make it work
The material is soft, flowing, and breathable. It does run super large, I already sized down twice. Love this shirt though. So cute.
This blouse exudes fun! It's like wearing spring time! The look is very chic pajamas. I believe it's made to be worn oversized but definitely runs big - you could definitely size down.

links_reviews_title: SO FUN! I got tons of compliments wearing this top!
links_reviews_text: Fits BIG, meant to be worn slouchy. Kinda hipstery.

This is an oversized silk blouse. It's 100% silk, and feels good to wear. I wore the smallest size available, and it is still big, so I even don't think sizing down is going to achieve a fitted look for most people. Instead, realize that if you want to wear only fitted blouses, this isn't the blouse for you. I personally love an oversized silk blouse with skinny jeans. Thus, this blouse was a hit with me. I think it's weird that people on RTR gauge the success of an outfit on the amount of external validation received, but since it seems to be worth mentioning for so many people, I concede that I received many compliments on the top, and have worn it several times in the week I've have it during my unlimited subscription.

This shirt runs super large. While it is supposed to have a boxy, oversized fit, I found it way too big on me in my normal size. It was too bulky to even wear tucked in, so the only way I could style it without looking like I wearing an oversized pajama top was to tie it at the waist. Definitely size down.
It's quite oversize and looks like pajamas, which I actually love -- The colors wash me out a bit (red-head complexion), which is the only reason I wouldn't rent again.
Love the pattern. The fit is oversized and a little boxy but works with skinny jeans

links_reviews_title: Fun print, silk fabric, casual slay
links_reviews_text: Men and hipsters especially loved the shirt (I got lots of compliments from my lyft driver to pedestrians in Dunkin Donuts.) Loved the casual ease of it, as well as the colors and print.

links_reviews_title: Cool and editorial, a bit tricky to style
links_reviews_text: I love this fabulous shirt, although to be honest I had a difficult time styling it  I think mostly because of the colors. I do love the colors  the pink is so pretty and I like how the patterns mix on the front and back of the shirt, and there is light blue piping which is probably hard to see in pictures but really gives it an extra special something. In terms of fit, its definitely super oversized. It wasnt too long, but long enough that you can wear it with any low-waist pants you may have left over without exposing anything. A bit too long to wear with shorts without tucking it in. You could definitely size down if you are between, or even size down one size probably regardless, but its supposed to be an oversized fit. The shirt looks very nice over skinny pants  I wore it with white jeans, which was a good color combo, but because of the dark royal/navy I didnt think it looked good with blue jeans except for a really light wash. It also looked surprisingly great tucked into a casual short black summer skirt with a relaxed, medium-rise waist  I tried it with something high-waisted and full-skirted and that didnt work AT ALL. I liked it generally over a fuller skirt untucked too, but that is very editorial and will not please girls who are looking for something flattering. All in all, it doesnt really play with a structured bottom well and is best either over something similarly relaxed or over a legging pant. Its a challenging item but very chic and worth a try  the perfect rental.

This is an easy-to-wear pajama style shirt. As per the other reviews, I downsized to a Size 38/US2 from my usual Size 6, and even with my broad shoulders, there was still plenty of room. While I did manage to get a few wears out of this, it's worth noting that I received ZERO compliments. Doubt I would rent again since overall it was just "meh".
This shirt was very large, order at least two sizes down!
I usually wear a 4. I received this and had to double check that it was a 40 because it was gigantic. Size down 2 at least.
sfas
I wish i could wear this everyday. Oversized, but flattering.
way too big.
Love this top. The pattern is just fun and unexpected. Can be dressed up or down. Received many compliments! On my favorites list for sure.

Really cute if you can figure out correct size. I previously rented another shirt from this brand so knew to size down, sized down 2 but should have done 3 and still would have at the oversized look that is intended.

I'm full busted so reading the other reviews I thought going down one size would work. Wrong. I looked like I was in daddy's pajamas. Disappointed as this is a very cute pattern. Will try again in a 38".
So cute! Tons of compliments. Very comfy and lightweight. Goes with everything!

links_reviews_title: REally unique looking. Can be worn untucked or tucked into jeans. Loved it!
links_reviews_text: It's a bit loose, but not TOO loose. Love the unique patterns and got so many compliments on this shirt. Perfect to be dressed up or down.
Loved the patterns and variety of colors in this Marni blouse. So easy to pair with jeans or shorts to add a little funky style. It does run really big and boxy but love that about it!
HUGE SHIRT

Cute top that stands out in a crowd of office blacks and whites, a bit long tho, so had to tuck in so it doesn't make me look shorter than I already am at 5 1. I've come to learn that most European sizes are a bit long torso wise--- shame, cuz otherwise they'd be awesome.

links_reviews_title: It was work and then brunch
links_reviews_text: Loved this. It is a bit large, but tuck it in with high wasted pants or something. I loved it and would've bought it but it's still super expensive even after the reduced price!
Too big to wear
As usual, the size I would normally wear is huge on RTR!?!?
Beautiful print, comfortable top and wear from work to event
Massive looked like a bed time shirt
The colors of this top were great and would have looked adorable with high waisted pants but the shirt size ran HUGE. Size down at least two sizes.

It's 100% silk I believe - so comfortable for this TX heat wave. I wore it around the house a ton because it was so luxuriously cool. As for out of the house... I wore it to work once. It is huge which worked for me since I am plus size, the arms fit very generously and were a great length. The shirt itself was a little long and super boxy, which is definitely a look. I wore it with released-hem jeans and tied it in front. However, it kind of looks like a fancy uniform for a 1950s lady janitor or candy striper or something.

The pattern was out of my comfort zone (I always wear solid colors and was trying to be adventurous) - it was "louder" than it looked in pictures on the app. It ran pretty big and loose so it wasn't really flattering.
Love this - runs a bit oversize but I don't mind that in a buttondown. I wore it to a rooftop bar on a super hot day and it was the perfect breezy addition to my outfit.
Fun shirt, great pattern and cool collar piping detail

Ordered one size up for this because I wanted a comfy fit and button ups always tend to be too fitted in the chest for me. This was HUUUUUGE!! My normal size would have already been oversized. Size down if you want a less slouchy fit. Other than that, loved this top to death!!

I rented this for work with unlimited. It is a non stretch silk. Pros: fun pattern and colors, comfortable pajama style fit- can be worn tucked in or out with jeans Cons: none noted I styled with dark boyfriend jeans, black belt and black suede pumps with a pastel yellow clutch.

Rented this through RTR unlimited while I work from home during shelter in place. This was cute. A little short for me, but I think it was the style. It was almost velvet material. I liked it and wore it a few times before returning it.
Super comfy sweatshirt, but made me look a bit more "put together" than a regular hoodie.
I loved this! Sooooo comfy and did not stop getting compliments!
This is true to size while being oversized in all the right ways. Wore it more times than I can count, mostly with black jeans, Timberland boots, and chunky gold hoops. Highly recommend this rental.
This was so comfy and easy to wear. Love the retro corduroy! I got many compliments- and my kids said I was " cool", ha! Ha!
Loved the texture and throwback look. Great with jeans, leggings, or layered.
Rented with my unlimited and wore it 3 times. Comfortable, retro and vibrant. Great sweatshirt and got tons of compliments. Everyone wanted it.

One of those tops to wear on the weekend running errands, meeting for coffee, and could even take you to evening for a casual outing - and still look cute. Super comfy like a thin sweatshirt, but with the zebra print, stylish. I decided that for my petite frame and short torso these cropped boxy styles don't flatter me, so I tucked the front in a little and it looked better. Also normally a size 6 but based on the reviews I decided to size way down to a 2 and it was the right choice.

links_reviews_title: Love Sundry! Super soft and comfy. Love for lounging
links_reviews_text: Fits big, but super cute and comfy
Great little just everyday sweatshirt style top.

Sweatshirt material so more appropriate for weekend unless you are in a super casual office. Has a boxy fit but not too boxy. The piece I had was very worn so must be very popular. Looked like it was about to pill. Other than that, loved it!

links_reviews_title: Super easy to pair with jeans or for a quick errand with leggings!
links_reviews_text: Great for every day. The size 1 was a little oversized but because of it being more cropped, I liked it a little bigger.

links_reviews_title: Fun, casual top to wear with sweats or jeans.
links_reviews_text: This is a great top for wearing on the weekends. Either with sweats to look dressed up or a casual pair of jeans.
Print is different and fun, otherwise not that special.
Really liked this. I wore it exactly as pictured, running errands/working from home. Even wore it with booties and went to a Halloween party as a casual zebra. Will consider keeping another month.
Cute/comfy/fits well. Nothing that special though
I love Sundry. I rented this because I wouldn't have bought this print. Got compliments!
TTS, didn't want to give it back. Highly recommend!
Heavy, high-quality, and stretchy material. Definitely requires a tank-top though.

links_reviews_title: Nice for work, but didn't love the neckline.
links_reviews_text: It was a nice weight fabric, but I wound up not loving the wider V neckline with collar. Just personally didn't feel as though it flattered my large shoulders. Other than that, great dress for a different body type.
It was nice to wear a wrap dress that didn't fly open when I walked. Nice dress, just not a love for me
Loved this for work to a cocktail party event. It's a thick fabric so feels structured but it's stretchy and flattering. Received several compliments.

I typically struggle finding dresses that can accommodate for my relatively bigger shoulders for my smaller waist and chest - with this heavier but sturdy material and the wrap design, for the first time I feel confident and comfortable in this slight v-neck of a dress. Loved it so much that I bought it!!! Use RTRRACHELD for $100 off your first two months of Unlimited and check out @rachydai for more pics of this fit.
Very very boobalicious, and not in a good way. I also did not expect the fabric to be so thick and heavy. Would be better for fall weather if it fit.
Dress is super comfy. The only issue i had was needing to safety pin the top for discretion. However, this is not unusual For me as I am small chested. Very pretty. Will rent again
Great for work; flattering color. Lots of stretch makes this easy to wear.
Another great DVF dress! The black dress with brown stitching is a subtle but nice detail

I love the weight of the knit fabric on this. It causes the dress to lay and drape very nicely. The dress just doesn't seem to close enough up top To wear without a tank underneath. I can't imagine even in bigger sizes that it would.
Rented this for a jacket and tie fundraising dinner. It worked well but I could have also worn to work. A bit snug but that's a wrap dress. Length was perfect on my 5'2" frame. Would rent again.
Love this dress, my second time renting it. Fits super well, wish I could own it.

links_reviews_title: Wore to banquet in DC- cute and fun, while still professional!
links_reviews_text: Wore a black cami under, as cut is quite low at the chest. Super comfy and flattering!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful heavy fabric but wrap did not fit on top.
links_reviews_text: Maybe I just can wear wrap dresses without a camisole. I really liked the dress despite that.

This dress was amazing. I received so many compliments. It was comfortable, flattering, feminine, I could go on! I'm sure I'll wind up buying it. The wrap weight and length was perfect, no Marilyn moments with this one on a windy day. Try it out, you won't regret it!

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous dress, but if you are big-busted, plan for a cami! Fabric tape a NO GO!
links_reviews_text: Lovely, thick fabric that drapes awesomely and stays put in the legs and arms. Fabric tape WILL NOT adhere to this dress, so if you are large-chested, you will HAVE to wear a camisole, which kind of messes up the overall effect. See my photo for the end result. A great dress otherwise!
Really liked the material, thick and stretchy. It ran a bit small in the chest area so had to wear a cami but fit perfectly everywhere else.

links_reviews_title: Solid work dress. Definitely needed cami underneath.
links_reviews_text: Substantial knit, well made dress.

links_reviews_title: Cute. Flattering. Dresses up or down
links_reviews_text: Nice work staple. Super quality and fits well. If you have a large chest will definitely need a tank under.

links_reviews_title: Very cute but need safety pins!
links_reviews_text: Liked this dress, a flattering thick stretchy knit but it is a wrap dress and is very open on top (though i am a B cup). I had to double safety pin to make work appropriate. But love it !

links_reviews_title: Unique structure and textured dress for work
links_reviews_text: Cute wrap dress with think stretchy fabric. Hard to tell in the photos but the skirt is actually corded. Like most wrap dresses it requires some effort. I felt like I was constantly adjusting the dress and tightening the belt. You will want to wear a slip underneath just so that when the dress inevitably slips you will still be covered. Despite all that, the dress was still totally appropriate and cute for work. Would probably be even better in the summer months.

links_reviews_title: Well made but needed larger size
Cute Dress - Very Booby - Tad Short for the Tall
links_reviews_text: Very low cut, but worked perfectly with a black bandeau. If you're on the taller side, just know that you will not be able to bend down without flashing someone. The wrap is great for hiding a bit of a belly or bloat, and accentuates my hips nicely.
Work appropriate and worked for nursing and pumping!
I wore a tank top to cover cleavage.
I'm a small chested woman - and this didn't cover the chest area. Didn't end up wearing.
The sleeves were a little tight, but other than that it fit really well. Its hard to go wrong with a simple black dress.
Perfect for a work conference
Fits nicely, flattering. Looks expensive. Hangs well.

links_reviews_title: Received SO many compliments from work colleagues.
links_reviews_text: This dress is amazing for work. I work at a Fortune 500 company and I didn't feel like my regular work clothes helped me "dress for the job I want." Wearing this dress helped me feel confident and professional.
True to size -- good with tall boots
Really sharp dress. Glad I read other reviews about wearing a cami under the dress - absolutely a necessity. Received many compliments.
I had too much room on top and it was not wearable. Could have added a cami for coverage but I still had a lot of fabric to go nowhere.

links_reviews_title: Didn't wear because it was too small.
links_reviews_text: Will rent in the future in a larger size.
Loved the black with wire sticking making this a modern look for a classic DV dress. Fabric stretches but thick enough to hide any imperfections. Wore with a cami as deep Vs don't work for work.
I ordered this during the wrong season this material is very thick it fits beautifully however it is not for a hot fall day where there still humidity in the air in the south

links_reviews_title: Adorable - great cut and stitching details are stand out. Had to wear a tank under for coverage :)
