Even though it wasn't a formal work event I still felt it was too short to be able to wear in front of co-workers. Unfortunately I wasn't able to wear this beautiful dress as a result. Don't rent for work if you're above average height!
This dress was pretty lovely, but the fabric wasn't appropriate for Chicago's winter temps (it clung really badly).
Great style but order larger size
Just nothing special. The tie is really big and awkward and the dress is otherwise shapeless and boring. Also very short and I am only 5'1".

From looking at the dress online I thought it would be more of a sweater material but it's not it's silk and doesn't stretch so I found it ran small for me. It's also short. The neck detail is pretty but overall the cut just made me feel like a square
So small couldn't put on. If you are pear curvy shaped -- get 1-2 sizes up

links_reviews_title: Chic and high quality, but not white
links_reviews_text: Based on the stock photo, I thought this would be a white turtleneck. It's much more off white or cream. I still liked it for work. It reminded me of Shiv from succession. Looks very high quality.
Paired this with embroidered jeans for Easter Sunday at home with my family. Got so many compliments!
I love this sweater! I was worried about getting a large because I usually wear a medium, but it was perfect! I will probably be renting this again sometime soon.

This is a very current/stylish basic that is good for the summer to fall transition. I wore it multiple times over the weekend. I typically wear a medium, but only large was available, and it ended up being slightly oversized which I actually preferred.
Cute simple top. Rented this as an update item & wore it pretty often throughout the month. Wish the XS was available for a more fitted style.
A bit frumpy, not flattering for larger chested ladies. Fabric was sheer and highlighted my body in all the wrong places.

links_reviews_title: Loved it. Looked so classy, fit great.
links_reviews_text: Need to wear a nude bra underneath, but other than that, it's perfect.
The smell of the dry cleaning chemicals was really overpowering. Fit was great and it was super soft.
Comfy fit. Off white color, nice design.

The top fits true to size but overall isn't the most flattering if you are busty or have an hourglass shape. I was hoping this would be a basic easy wear but I felt like it really clung to my stomach, boobs, and arms - didn't make me feel too good ! I found this is consistent with Phillip Lim sweaters

links_reviews_title: Ribbed wool not gonna work when you have parts to hide
links_reviews_text: No idea why I thought this type of top was going to work for me. I think I just tricked myself because I wanted a simple (off) white top. The rubbing just shows my tummy bulge really easily and manages to not flatter my decently large chest. In a medium it fit fine, but just showed all my little imperfections too easily. I'll trust my instinct next time and just know this kind of top just generally doesn't work for me. Quality and all is good but only recommend if you are not curvy or busty.
very stretch, I'm 5"3, 34ddd, so it hung below my hips, it was flattering and warm overall
The fit is great and it's a comfortable, high versatile top. I wore it to work and on the weekend.
Very nice sweater that is flattering does stretch out as the day goes by and I would rather rent it again in a small
This is super cute for all occasions

links_reviews_title: Basic white turtleneck that pairs well with everything
links_reviews_text: Fit was true to size not restrictive like some ribbed turtlenecks. The hanger marks were pretty noticeable on the shoulders

Perfect for work. Excellent quality. I wore it with dark skinny jeans, a tweed blazer, and riding boots. I felt very Town and Country! Got lots of compliments from both coworkers and my husband. The only con is that it was a tad bit on the short side in length. Was fine since I had a blazer over it and works well tucked in it with high waisted pants, but might be an issue for regular rise pants or taller gals.

links_reviews_title: I wore this for work with a buffalo print and shearling coat with black leggings.
links_reviews_text: I like this item when worn under the coat. Probably wouldn't wear on its own. It is a bit see through, so definitely wear a nude or similar color bra. It wasn't the most flattering on my arms, so I kept the coat on the whole time. The neck is very high, went right under my chin when folded over. It is soft, and has a nice stretch without looking like you are trying to squeeze into a too-small sweater.

Loved how flowy and comfortable this was. The material and pattern were perfect for spring. Would be cute with a Jean jacket for a weekend or with black tights and booties for work. Complimented my bump while not making it the center-piece of the outfit. Felt like my self in this one. Will definitely rent again after the #covid19 lockdown
I liked it. It was flowing and soft fabric, flattering cut.

Loved the print of this dress. True to other reviews, it is tight in the busy, and loose in the waist. But RTR's recommended size was absolutely perfect. Easy to cinch with a belt. Material is on the thin side, so not the warmest. Loved it!!

Fit was great. I saw other reviews of women wearing a belt with this dress so I tried that and loved how it tied the whole look together. I got so many compliments at work- the dress was equal parts comfortable and fashionable.

Considering buying - felt perfect for a hot day outside, by then while in the office all day. Hit at right length at knee, added a belt to give it a figure. Professional- received lots of compliments! Could wear with tights and boots in winter.
Beautiful light fabric. I ended up wearing a black belt when I wore it to my work conference. Length was perfect and the print is beautiful! Highly recommend!
Super flattering, great summer work dress
The color and the fit were perfect! I received lots of compliments. Fit well even in my third trimester.
This is a great dress with a vintage feel, but it definitely needs a belt. Otherwise, it looks really big and a little like a tent. Great color, and I got a lot of compliments!

Took cue from other reviewers & ordered a size up. Fit great, despite my broad shoulders. Comfortable fit. Appropriate for a bus casual office. Dress hits mid-calf on shorter gals, but still wearable with flats.

I packed this dress to wear at a conference, and it served its purpose. It traveled well (didn't need pressing) and was comfortable. It looked okay on me until I started moving around. It just wouldn't stay put and kept riding up to where I had to keep pulling it down so it would sit right. It's a cute dress but maybe I think its the combination of fabric and construction that keeps it from sitting where it should.

links_reviews_title: Wore on panel, very high quality dress!
links_reviews_text: Great fit!
Pro: elegant Con: must wear a slip otherwise the material slips in between your legs as you walk. Really low cut

The cut was a little mumu like, but the fabric had a shine to it and it was a bold pattern. Those three things combined made for a relaxed but bold outfit. Side zipper for the dress, but I easily put on the dress without using the zipper. Overall cute, but casual with the loose cut.

Loved this dress for a work event. The magenta is vibrant and looks great paired with navy. As others said, it was a bit tight in the chest for me (34D) but was more of an issue with the jacket on over it. It definitely has volume, but the length balances it out so it's not too poofy. Got lots of compliments and will definitely wear it again before I send it back!

As others have said, this dress is tight up top! I think it's tight in the upper back rather than in the chest, however. I chose my size by looking at reviews from people with the same bra size as me and it served me well. The fabric is vibrant and slightly shiny. It does not stretch at all. The fabric is thin but does not breathe so keep that in mind when renting for extreme temperature situations. The collar is super cute but did not want to lie flat and I found myself constantly adjusting it throughout the day. The overall shape and movement of this piece is beautiful, though. I might rent thin one again.
Didn't have much shape to it but I loved the pattern. Very lightweight so it would be a good work dress for spring or summer.

links_reviews_title: Comfy dress for a girl with curves!
links_reviews_text: Super comfortable, a bit snug in the bust area if you have DD... contemplating buying! Flattering for anyone that a larger mid section like I do!
Liked it as a dress and played with it to edge up the style a bit. Would not rent again because it fell a little flat for me.
Paired it with a skinny belt - loved the colors. Very work event appropriate. Got lots of compliments.

This is snug in the chest as others have noted- fortunately not an issue for me! I got all the compliments. The pattern is perfect, hard to tell if it's animal print or like blood cells which is right up my alley!

links_reviews_title: Get the dress size to fit your chest.
links_reviews_text: This ended up being an interesting surprise. I read the previous reviews that complained about the baggy skirt and didn't expect to like this, but when I put it on I was pleasantly surprised by it. The colors are a gorgeous fuchsia and navy. The fabric is light and flows - perfect for a hot day (which it was not), and the top is perfectly fitted for this small D. The dress does have a lot of fabric, but it's made to be that way. It's the look and it's very comfortable. I liked the uniqueness of it. Be warned of static cling. I took mine out of the bag for a few days, then wiped the inside and my undergarments with a dry sheet. Did the trick. I can see this being beautiful as a maternity dress, as well.
Cool and comfortable with the quarantine weight gain.

links_reviews_title: Would Buy it if I Could
links_reviews_text: Obsessed. Got 75 compliments. I felt so pretty. Fit was perfect and flattering. Loved the twist on a typical leopard print.

Loved this dress! It was great with black tights in the winter. I didn't realize it's more of a silk material until I got it, but that dressed it up since the shape is a bit boxy (which I liked). Not pregnant but this would be great for early maternity.
Definitely snug in the chest area, but if you size for that area, it's a beautiful dress that I received multiple compliments on.

links_reviews_title: Unexpectedly, I really loved this dress!
links_reviews_text: Fits your figure nicely from the back. I just put it on over my head, but then saw it had a side zipper. Tastefully low but not didn't show cleavage and not too short, so great for work. Very class & professional. I got this to camouflage tummy but it did not make me feel like a was wearing a maternity dress. That being said, if you are in first or second trimester get this dress!
Comfy & stylish. Fun dress for work.
The fabric did not have quite the drape I expected. I wore it with tights and a sweater because it was cold. The colors are fun.
Loved the print but am not sold on the shape. Plenty of room for my 25 week baby bump.

The pattern on this is lovely, and I received a ton of compliments. The neckline drapes really nicely, and the V neck was cut at a good level to be flattering, but still modest enough for work. I was surprised at the 100% polyester fabric, which felt a bit stiff when I first tried it on. This ended up being perfect though, I packed it for a work trip and there were very few wrinkles.
I wish I would have sized down a bit, but loved this overall.
This dress was fun paired with a cardigan and belt.

links_reviews_title: Pretty color, flattering fit, comfortable dress
links_reviews_text: I wore this to Thanksgiving but I'd also wear this to work. It's a beautiful color with a pretty neckline and a flattering length. This size is a little snug in the bust, but I works to want bigger because it fit everywhere else well. I was surprised to see it is polyester. It seemed like silk.

links_reviews_title: Just to baggy and not my favorite
links_reviews_text: I didn't wear it. Too big and too long. Might be better as a maternity dress

links_reviews_title: great dress but I took size 0 in because 4 was too big even though that's the size I normally wear
links_reviews_text: Looks nice

links_reviews_title: Loved this - great print, even prettier in person. Love the sleeve length and color!
links_reviews_text: Great for work, evening, church, etc. With tights or without. Light sheen to it, lots of compliments on the print!
Wore this for a big work presentation and felt awesome. It's a power dress, but fun and feminine! A little big, but a belt helped.
The colors on this dress are beautiful! The cut is feminine and polished. It can be worn to work or out for a nice dinner/event depending on how you accessorize it. Highly recommend.
I typically wear a 34 or 36-- but this time the 36 was too loose, especially under a blazer.
Super comfy, easy to wear can take you day into night

It was lightweight and cute but longer than expected. I wore spanx under it so it wouldn't be sheer in the daylight and I'm glad bc the button at the bottom kept coming undone but overall it was fine. No stretch to fabric, but easy to style and rewear for everyday occasions.
Very cute and comfy. Wrinkles easily

links_reviews_title: The perfect LBD for vacation / summer
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress. Wore it 3X in one week. Couldn't get enough. I would use a shall or different shoes to change the look. Looks great with Sandals or sneakers.
I really liked the fit of the dress however the material was transparent.
Essentially fit like a paper bag on my body, runs very large
Such a great dress for everyday casual wear. I absolutely loved this dress.
This is one of those dresses that could be worn out or for an afternoon in the park. Super easy and comfy
Nice light fabric, fits true to size and easy to wear. Will def rent again.
Was disappointed with the fabric, wrinkles easily, did not flatter

Such a beautiful, soft, cozy trendy sweater. But WOW I was swimming in it (I'm 5'3!) the arms were way too long, the sleeves were too big and wide, the body of the sweater too long and oversized. Too big too even look cute/ work appropriate on a casual Friday. Bummer!
I feel like this sweater looks better in person than it does on the model. It was very soft and had a semi dramatic sleeve. I really enjoyed this one

links_reviews_title: Sleeves not a huge as I imagined!!
links_reviews_text: I was afraid these sleeves were going to go on for days after reading the reviews... I thought they were fine. I don't mind a longer sleeve and this length is just cozy enough! Overall - cute subtle print, super cozy, wore it to work on a Friday with jeans. Also not THAT short, although I am only 5'4"

The sleeve on this are ridiculous. Too long and a huge bell all the way down. I typically like my sweaters oversized but the proportions on this just made it very unflattering. This sweater left me very disappointed. The only upside it had was that it was soft.

links_reviews_title: A subtle pattern - probably good to match with an exciting bottom
links_reviews_text: The pattern on this is very subtle so probably a good sweater to pair with a bold bottom. The fit is a bit large, the sleeves are on the longer side. The material is soft and comfortable.
Love this sweater! It has a roomy, over sized fit. The sleeves are wide and trendy and the pattern is fun! The fabric has a little bit of sheen to it that makes it great for work or date night.

links_reviews_title: TALL girls will LOVE this sweater
links_reviews_text: I'm tall with long arms and this sweater is AMAZING for us lanky girls. I love the ultra-long sleeves and the exaggerated shape. If you're petite or have shorter arms this probably won't work for you. But, tall girls will love it -- great everyday casual piece.

links_reviews_title: Easy and comfortable but looks so polished!
links_reviews_text: So comfortable. Great fit. But the pattern and silhouette make it stylish. Loved it so much I bought it!

I loved the subtle tiger print on this sweater! one thing to note is that the sleeves are definitely exaggerated! They are an extra long bell sleeve - so beware. I have long arms so this worked out fine for me!

I liked the print of this sweater - makes a plain black top a little more interesting, bust still goes with everything - but I found it annoying to wear. The bell sleeves kept getting in my way, and it felt just big and bulky, so unflattering and the waist line hit in a weird place. I would have liked it if it were a bit more cropped and the sleeves were shorter or slimmer
super easy and cute

This sweater was super comfy, baggy and great for the house. The sleeves are large bell sleeves though so they get into everything. Not ideal for washing hands, cooking, anything that uses your hands! Super warm though
Giant sleeves and baggy boxy fit. Suggest sizing way down

links_reviews_title: Wore to a casual outdoor engagement party!
links_reviews_text: This sweater is adorable and very warm! The sleeves do run long and are kind of a bell-sleeve, but I rolled them twice and it looked cute and finished still. Love the pattern and material is very soft. I would definitely recommend.
Because this is pretty oversized, it looks very casual. For a more polished look I would size down 1-2 sizes.
Definitely oversized, but rented for a chilly day at work. Material is super soft and the animal print pattern is subtle
The sleeves are very drop and huge bells -- not super flattering.

Agree with all of the reviews that the sleeves were way too large. Medium fit perfect everywhere but the sleeve length. I was able to double cuff the sleeves and it was really cute for work. Would definitely rent again despite the sleeves!

links_reviews_title: way too big, seemed plus size
links_reviews_text: too big, very wide neck and huge bell sleeves

links_reviews_title: I hated the too long bell shaped sleeves. I don't think the picture shows that, but I could not wear
links_reviews_text: I hated the too long bell shaped sleeves. I don't think the picture shows that, but I could not wear
this sweater runs large loved the wide sleeves the material is comfortable just ok nothing special

links_reviews_title: picked this up today and already wore it to dinner. update- I love it. have worn it like 3 times in
links_reviews_text: heavy weight in a good way- super comfortable and looks polished too! sleeves are quite long and also wide so they hang- better for drinks or activities- can hang into meal when eating.

I didn't find the sleeves as heavy/long as other reviewers have mentioned. The sweater definitely fits loose, but still very cozy. Not the most flattering fit, but definitely good for a winter weekend.
The sweater is really thick, too thick. It runs really large and the sleeves bell out, nothing like the picture. It is not flattering at all.
Sized down after reading the reviews and it was a perfect fit.

links_reviews_title: Fun black on black tiger stripe print, wide bell sleeves.
links_reviews_text: Fun black on black tiger stripe print, wide bell sleeves. Very cozy.
I wish I had paid better attention when renting this but the sleeves are super long making it hard to do about anything which resulted in my just returning without wearing.
This is like a kind of chenile-ish material that was super weird feeling, and was awkwardly boxy and big.

This sweater is a bit of a disaster. First of all, the pattern and fabric are beautiful, but the width and length of the arms makes it completely unwearable! They are massively wide bell sleeves, and about 5 inches too long. Too wide, heavy, and floppy to be rolled. I couldn't even figure out how to wrap them around my arms to fit them in my winter jacket. In addition, the sweater itself is boxy and oversized, and the neck hole was too wide. It was unflattering all around. My entire family laughed at it and told me to take it off. Save your coveted slot. Do not bother with this sweater.
Just OK. The arms are way too long. The sweater is very heavy, cute, but too big to wear.

links_reviews_title: Not much to it, giant sleeves annoying
links_reviews_text: The zebra-like pattern is not very discernible in person and the sleeves just got in the way of everything.
Soft material, great for vacation
Rented for 2 week vacation and wore it a ton! Size 2 was still a bit baggy on me.
Paired with the matching pants for a concert and it was a hit. I received so many compliments! Would rent again for a fun event or something similar.

links_reviews_title: Fun, comfy shirt for casual Miami night
links_reviews_text: Style of shirt is supposed to be big, so had a comfy, fancy feel to it. Great vibrant colors for Miami vacation.

links_reviews_title: Nice shirt for summer or vacation
links_reviews_text: Cute enough shirt for vacation, and I liked the print with the trees and animals. Nothing too special, and I'm not a huge fan of green but it served its purpose.

I wanted this top for Florida but found wearing at home merely extended my vacation. Bright and fun silk fabric has no stretch and is cut for a boxy feel- not unlike silk pajamas. Comfortable like pajamas too! I styled with the matching pants a couple times with silver chunky jewelry and silver sandals. Also styled the top with boyfriend jeans and neon yellow handbag and loafers. Loved it.

The shirt was amazing! I rented this along with the pants for a post surgery outfit. I needed something that would button and go on and off easily. The shirt is nice and oversized so it's roomy and the material is very comfy. Lotta compliments!

This top is a little boxy but the color and print are to die for!! I got so many compliments on the top that it made me brave enough to get the matching pants, which I wore to a concert. The top alone can totally work for everyday, whether it's work, brunch, errands, vacation. I wore this top 3-4 times and was sad to give it back.
This shirt will give you major vacation feels. Great quality and I LOVED THE PRINT! The material is much shinier in person compared to the image online. Top runs big so size down.
This is one of my favorite rentals. I wore it almost daily. It's fun, versatile and just has vibes. I went with the Seth Rogen goes to Key West look often.

links_reviews_title: Fun pop of color and trendy
links_reviews_text: Fit oversized which I wanted. It's a fun print and gorgeous color.
I loved this top! It has a silky feel and fits true to size. It's super comfortable - would definitely rent again!
This silky shirt was so on trend it's well made and I think it's meant to be worn baggy as it was big on me. Got lots of compliments!
Ended up wearing this a couple of times. I liked it but was surprised to see it retailed for over $300 since it was polyester and not silk. Fabric seemed a bit cheap but I enjoyed the style.

I was so happy to receive this item. Feels so nice on and the color is amazing. I plan on wearing this out to Montauk worn open with a bathing suit underneath. Definitely going to get a lot of wear out of this top.
Silky and oversized. I think it looks really cute knotted in the front.

links_reviews_title: Cute, unique print in a fun, bright color!
links_reviews_text: Great fit, more of a flowy material and less structured

I wore this on vacation casually during the day. I loved it - bold colors in person too. It is a very, very loose fit if you're petite like me so if left untucked, it would have looked huge and unflattering on me. Instead I ended up tying it in the front to give it an more fitted look over high waisted shorts and it looked great - would rent again.
Super soft/silky blouse. Boyfriend style bright and fun. I wore front tucked with both white shorts and a black bodycon style midi skirt while on a cruise.
Lots of comments, very nice quality. It runs very big and boxy.
I LOVED this top. The green is so beautiful and I got tons and tons of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Cute top for a couple wears
links_reviews_text: Large fit as others noted, it's also poly which I don't love but I'm ok with for a couple wears. Cute tied up at the waist, love the color and print but not a keeper for me!
Super loose. Very bright. If you like those things, great shirt. If not, you'll feel weird wearing it.
Runs pretty large, still can have the oversized look with sizing down a couple sizes. Reminds me of a Hawaiian dad shirt, but in a good way. Really nice summer shirt.

links_reviews_title: I love this over-sized silk shirt. It's a fun way to camp it up, but still be chic.
links_reviews_text: Runs a bit large, although that is the style. I would size down.
This was an easy top for vacation and the print was really eye catching. It does run extremely wide and boxy. I recommend sizing down.
Buying this. LOVE the color...Very vibrant green. The size/shape is very forgiving. They only had a Medium, which I wore and it was fine. Though my true size probably should have been a Small/XS.
Easy cute top pairs with tons of things. Loved the way it fit and the color. Fabric feels okay, not super breathable. More styling photos on IG @sereinwu

links_reviews_title: Perfect fit, Bright color, and comfort
links_reviews_text: I have big shoulders and it gave me plenty of room in the shoulders and still fit my mid section.
wore for a graduation (school color) really cute crop top
I think this runs a tiny bit large because the XS fit great and I'd normally consider myself a true S. The cropped style looks great with high waisted pants and wedges/heels.
Definitely cropped. Loose, lots of accidental bra shots, but comfy and cute. Good for spring.
I loved this piece, it was bright and fun, although a little low cut and occasionally it would gape open a bit, however I loved it and would definitely rent this again.
Tight in chest.
just make sure you're ok with a long crop top and you're good to go
Midriff too exposed
Loved this top! Fit was loose and only slightly cropped if you wear high waisted pants which I liked. Pretty true to size but if you're in between I would size down. Would definitely rent again!
I really liked this top and the color. It pulled a little to one side so often looked uneven but it was a great everyday top to wear to work.
It showed a little more tummy than I thought it would, but I still loved the shirt. I'd rent again.
Beautiful but not ideal for big boobs.

This ended up being higher cut than I imagined. Even with very high waisted jeans I was showing quite a bit of midriff. But, the color is absolutely beautiful. Next time would wear with a higher waisted skirt.

links_reviews_title: Cute, but Have some fashion tape handy
links_reviews_text: It is cute and covers more than a general crop top. The issue is that it's a light, airy design, but the cloth does not breathe. Also, if you slouch the front completely opens above the twist.
So cute! The color is very bright but looked good on with jeans. The front is very cropped.

I am a fan of this. Im average height and size and found this comfy - almost a Jersey material - but the drawn in waist means it's not too baggy and still is flattering. Pretty blue color. Fell at calf level but with a small slit so easy to walk - and bike! - in. Not a total showstopper dress but a solid, interesting dress to rent for work or weekend. For work, would probably add a jacket depending on how formal your office is.

Apologies for the lighting was running out the door and remembered to take photo. This dress fits perfectly. I wore it once with heels to work and then with wedges on the weekend. Comfortable and nice material

links_reviews_title: Love the cut of this dress!
links_reviews_text: The most comfortable fabric!

links_reviews_title: Love the stripes on this cute work dress
links_reviews_text: Wore it twice. Love the comfort and the black and blue stripes. Super easy to wear and move. I will say the L is true to size, maybe a touch small. I got it to be fitted, but might have liked a little more material to make the top blouse a bit more. A fine unlimited dress for work.

links_reviews_title: Fun and comfortable! So many compliments!
links_reviews_text: Wore this for work, super comfortable and relatively lightweight- great for us ladies that run hot! Got a lot of compliments on the color pop
For perfect, very comfortable yet professional. If wearing with tights a little clingy but nothing that a slip can't fix.

links_reviews_title: Picture does not do this justice.
links_reviews_text: I was worried that the length would make me appear shorter but it looked great and made me seem longer. Such a cute dress. I wore it once for work and then paired it with a moto jacket for a girls night.
Comfortable dress and very work appropriate. It is lightweight and true to size. I would recommend.
It's looser on top (good for larger busts) and slim through waist. The fabric is a stretchy cotton and very breathable. Another winner from Leota!
Great fit and color. Very comfortable to wear. A little form firing on lower stomach but overall very flattering, nothing a good pair of spanx can't help. Perfect work dress
I wish I would have gotten a small. This felt a little big. The blue was really pretty, and I liked the lines. This wasn't my favorite.
This dress fits tts, is comfortable, and work appropriate. I loved the blue/Black stripe color combo and got several compliments. Recommend.
Very flattering and comfortable, wore once to work, and to dinner a different night. TTS.

Loved this dress for a fall day in Texas. It's lightweight so might not work for super cold weather. Not wrinkle prone and was ready to wear right out of the garment bag! Paired with a long vest and booties. Compliments all day!

I love this dress! The stripes are so flattering and the colors are bold and artistic. This dress is a high quality knit and even though the waist is elastic the dress is cut so well. It is very flattering. I wore it twice and couldn't bear to send it back. I will keep my eye on this one of the price drops to buy!
I like most Leota dresses for work. I thought this one was cute. Would maybe be long for petites but worked fine for me.
Love: stripes and the fact that it was long sleeve. Challenge: it didn't quite fit my long arms. This dress was great for fall being a midi length and was snug without being tight.

links_reviews_title: I wore this to a work event. It was easy and comfortable to wear all day.
links_reviews_text: This dress fit well
This was very comfortable to wear. I wore it with a wide black belt and black cashmere cardigan over it, w/ black boots. got compliments. would rent again.
This dress is a great color and looks good on. However, I was surprised at how thin and t-shirt like the fabric was.
Dress was slightly too big. Will try a size down next time.
I liked how simple it was to wear this dress. Flattering everyday work dress.

Very light and comfortable materials. I paired with black pumps for work and got many compliments. I tried to ignore the fact that the stripes on the skirt did not match up perfectly but that's just me. It was a wonderful dress!
Tons of compliments. My friends said... you have to buy this one!! Super comfy.

I recently gained a lot of weight, and was looking for a dress I could feel confident at for a big work event. While I don't love the photos of me, I felt comfortable in the dress all night and it was perfect for the work party. The material is stretchy and soft, and the bold pattern makes it a stand out outfit. I would consider buying this dress!

links_reviews_title: Comfy and super cute! A new fave for sure!
links_reviews_text: I thought this dress would be far more "stiff" from the image. It turned out to be made of a jersey fabric that I threw on...no zippers or anything! It was super comfortable and looked stylish with black booties. Will definitely rent again! Wish I had it in a bunch of patterns!
So comfortable!
Super comfortable and polished for a business lunch and birthday dinner. Loved it.
I loved the material of this dress. Lightweight but not sheer at all. It was very comfortable and I would rent again if I needed to.

links_reviews_title: Good for work week or weekend
links_reviews_text: Fit was true to size, tightest (but not tight) through the hips. Hit just below the knee on me. Was able to pair it with casual boots for a weekend brunch and heels for the office, looking totally appropriate for both. Would definitely rent again and may even buy it next time!
Love the feel of the material. This was really comfortable to wear. Probably better for a cooler day than a warm day as the material doesn't breathe all that well. Cute and casual, though.

Rented the top and the pants and loved the look! Made of heavy silk - so not see through. Could have worn the top out or in. Perfect outfit for summer - wore to work and then lunch with friends. Especially love that I don't have to dry clean....just ship back and rent again! :). Fit true to size - wore the xsmall and I am a 34c and usually wear 0-2.

links_reviews_title: Tight around big chest but overall nice everyday piece.
links_reviews_text: Very good quality. Slightly tight around bigger bossomed girls.
Appreciated the thick but not heavy aspect of the material. Not see through at all. The black (or maybe it's really dark navy?) trim adds a nice touch. Will probably rent again

I got these pants with the matching top. I was glad I did, because the top comes down to cover the top of the pants which is needed because the pants are rather see-through. I wore flesh colored bike shorts underneath. I got a lot of compliments on the outfit.
I would size down in this one. Wasn't even able to wear it. Arm holes were huge
I'm a B cup and the bust was way too roomy. Could easily be a D cup and still fit into a size small. I would have needed a smaller size to wear this.
Fit well with a little bit of stretch. Solid material

links_reviews_title: Basic top, but nice details and flattering cut
links_reviews_text: I wore this a few times. To work with fancy pants, then dressed down with jeans.

It was ok. Too polyester for my taste. Didn't have that high end clothing vibe. Wrinkles way too easily and the XS is more like a Medium for a size 0 like myself. Not a bad blouse, but no WoW factor for me.
A bit too big. Fabric looks a bit cheap.

The material is thicker than I expected, which was great because it gave the top a bit more structure. I love the black details on the seams. It was comfortable to wear to work every day. It was a bit roomy on me, but still looked great and was a professional top to mix and match for different outfits.
Got a lot of compliment And wore it tucked into the matching pants
I should have sized down. The arm holes were huge.
True to size fit. The material is thick enough to hide bralines. I wore this both with a pair of jeans untucked and tucked into a leather skirt. Would absolutely recommend.
Runs large, especially in the arm holes. The fabric was a little odd - thick and stretchy. But it lay really nicely tucked in under a suit so I was happy.
fits great and true to size

links_reviews_title: Not the most flattering, but it's cute if you're skinny
links_reviews_text: I'm not big, but I'm not skinny and this made me look very wide. Probably great for stick skinny girls. Cute top though
It was ok. Neck stands away from your body a bit. Easy to dress up if need be
This was a good basic work dress with a nice cut and good color. Will rent again.

This is a simple plain dress yet it is not! The material is a heavier feel but not bulky. The seams and lines make this dress great ! Just the right amount of cleavage. Got many compliments! The 8 fit my 5'5" 34D 150lb body perfectly. Best of all it is so comfortable!! Will definitely rent again!!

links_reviews_title: Made me feel confident and professional!
links_reviews_text: Wore this for a big presentation at a conference. Killed the presentation and felt like a million bucks. The waist was a bit big but other than that it fit great.
This was a thicker jersey material. I would wear this in autumn and winter. The neck detail was a little big. This was a good work outfit and I received compliments on the fit and color.

links_reviews_title: Didn't wear because the fabric was uncomfortable to me.
links_reviews_text: I didn't love this when I opened the bag and the fabric just didn't feel right to me.

Nanette Lepore dresses are always some of my favorites. The flattering cut is perfect for pear shapes, the flowing skirt is perfect for twirling. This dress goes great from work to cocktails. Will absolutely rent again!
Fit nice for work. My body type does well with A lines.

links_reviews_title: Wore to an award ceremony related to work. Very flattering, well made
links_reviews_text: Wore to an award ceremony related to work. Very flattering, well made
It was a bit too low cut for my comfort for work, but otherwise a great look and would be nice for a party.
Wore with leggings and a blazer

This is a beautifully constructed dress. Great for work. I chose to wear shape garments underneath it, but I loved the way it fit. It's a little more understated than what I usually wear  but would be great in a formal work environment.

Fits true to size and the flare is forgiving if you've got a bit of a belly. But if you have any bust at all, the deep cut in front makes this veer on the side of inappropriate for work. I ended up having to cover up with a scarf although. Which is a shame because the dress and the collar is gorgeous.
fits perfectly

links_reviews_title: Wore this for an awards ceremony for work and it was perfect!
links_reviews_text: Ran a little large, typically a 6 and the 4 was perfect! Great quality material, tailored fit, and. beautiful color. I would definitely rent this again!
Great, thick fabric. Lovely aubergine color. The collar is very elegant. Great dress for fellow hourglass or pear-shaped women.

links_reviews_title: This dress was flattering and feels classy. I wore it to a vendor dinner at a trade show in Vegas.
links_reviews_text: The fit was good for the most part. It was very forgiving in the "belly" area. The "chest" area was a bit loose, and I could see the side part of my bra through the sleeve holes. I found one bra that didn't show as much, so I'm just going with that one. However I really liked this dress overall, I might rent again one size smaller.

This dress hung on me. I'm sometimes a 2, sometimes a 4, and should have rented the 2. The neckline was pretty. The material was thick and stretchy but picked up lots of lint during the day...I wouldn't rent again for that reason.

Cute dress - I ordered a size 10, but the dress is definitely too big on me. Additionally, I am 5'4" and the dress is a little long; hits just below my knee - which sometimes can be an unflattering length if you are on the shorter side. The dress is cute, and I would rent a smaller size again, but if I owned this, I would definitely take to a tailor to alter length.

links_reviews_title: So pretty to transition into fall
links_reviews_text: I typically wear a 6 in dresses and I rented a 6. This one is large all over, so it wasn't super flattering on me in a 6. The material is high quality, thick and it's lined. The front does have kind of a deep plunge, so it may not be good for very conservative environments. I'm looking forward to sizing down and renting this dress again-it's going to be gorgeous! A perfect transition into fall, for those of us in moderate to warm climates. This would also be cute with a little shrug or jacket for warmth.
Great for work. Comfortable material, nice color, good length. Love the neckline - I got so many compliments on it. Will definitely rent again.

This dress was just OK. Fit was true to size, but not particularly flattering. The paneling/stitching hits perfectly to really any emphasize any lower-stomach pooch and the material wrinkles really easily. The color is nice and the material is good quality though.
I liked the idea of this structured dress (higher collar, defined flare), but all of this combined with the cap sleeves on my athletic arms was pretty unflattering.

I needed a power dress for a stressful work meeting, and this fit the bill. I'm a broad shouldered and wide hipped 12, so knowing this designer runs small and that there were sleeves, I went 14. I think that was the right call, although the 12 might have worked - it felt a little big in the shoulders, but friends said it looked great. I got a ton of compliments on the dress! The neckline is a little low, but it's so narrow that I didn't feel like it was a problem. It was slightly longer on me than on the model, which I also appreciated.
Large in the bust area :(

links_reviews_title: High quality, v classy tailored dress
links_reviews_text: Loved it, loved the length and the weight of it - overall stunning, feminine structure v professional and sexy fit too. Excellent for many scenarios. Beautiful!

All good with this, kind of dress I would rent but not buy so loved wearing it once and I was done. The slit was not very comfortable, it was cut very high. Color was perfect with dark brown boots. It was easy and very trendy. Put a close up picture so you can see the color and pattern.
I dressed this wrap down and wore it to a day at the museum with my sister, however, it could easily go to work or to dinner. I loved it and would own it if I could!
Nice work dress with a satiny material but I was swimming in the size 10 (my usual size)
Loved this dress! Wore it for a work event and it was stylish while work appropriate. The sleeves were a bit long and big and I'm 5'11" so others may want to size down

I so so wish I could have loved this dress! When it arrived, the dress was a bit wrinkled at the bottom. I though -- NBD I'll just steam it. I steamed the night before I wore. When I put it on the next morning it was AMAZING, such flow, elegant Kate Middleton vibe. I sat on my ottoman to put on my shoes... WRINKLED within 30 seconds. I still wore it because I didn't want to "waste" a rental, ya know? This photo was after a 1/2 of wearing.

This dress made me feel so pretty and really fitted me perfectly. Accentuated my curves! I will totally rent this again. The fabric feels very rich and the cut is flattering. I wore it to two separate events. So classy! I received many compliments!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress for days that are not windy!
links_reviews_text: Absolutely adored the color of this wrap dress and the sleeves. Fit was fairly true to size, but would size up if in between. That said, with one gust of wind you might show your undergarments to the world. I chose to style it with a skinny pant and treat it as a top to avoiding any unintended flashing! In the photo I did tuck the dress into the pant, so the slit is not actually that high. I might also suggest some fashion tape to keep the dress a little more contained. Loved it, but would likely not rent again due to functionality concerns.
Very flattering cut. Many compliments. Wrinkles more than expected but still looks great. The dress moves really well when you walk.

I adored the color and the flowy fabric of this dress. I'm usually between and 10 and a 12, and ordered the 10 based on reviews of other Equipment pieces. It totally worked, but I wish I had ordered the 12. This is a true wrap dress and I'm not the narrowest at the waist ;) so I spent a lot of time adjusting this when sitting, to make sure my upper legs stayed appropriately covered. I think I could have used a little extra fabric! Altogether a pretty dress, though, with fun details.

links_reviews_title: Equipment knows how to flatter a woman's form
links_reviews_text: I love this dress! I got so many compliments on this everywhere I went when I wore it. I often hesitate to get wrap dresses as I find they are often too exposing in the front, however, I did not have that issue with this dress. everything stayed right where it was supposed to be. It did wrinkle a bit by the end of the day.

links_reviews_title: Not appropriate for work for busty women
links_reviews_text: Could be cute for a spring date night
This dress fit fine around my waist, but was large everywhere else. The effect was to make me look like a character out of little house on the prairie. It was very matronly and not at all flattering

I absolutely loved this dress and received may compliments from women and men! I felt it ran true to size. You do have to be cautious of the slit blowing open but it's a stunning dress and many people said I should own it!
Love the fabric but the sleeves are VERY long! If you are petite or have shorter arms, they end up looking a bit silly.

links_reviews_title: Size up it felt small and showed the world from my belly down.
links_reviews_text: The fit on this thing is odd. I thought I had sized up which I usually do but looks like I didn't. Either way for something that appears flowy it was anything but so feel like it ran small. On top of that it is a true wrap dress and no matter how much crossing of fabric I did one faulty move and the whole world was seeing from my waste down. There was no way I could have worn it to work or the evening I had planned with out being concerned with the dress all day. After having it on for only 5 minutes I decided to change.

links_reviews_title: I did not wear this dress.
links_reviews_text: The dress is gorgeous, but I could not wear it comfortably because of the waist. The problem is my waist is too thick. I would try it in a 12 but I think it might be too big everywhere else?

links_reviews_title: I got it in the RTR store which was nice- because then I could see it before I got it!
links_reviews_text: The arms were very tight and it was hard to get on. I didn't end up wearing it to work due to weather issues in my state, but its a pretty dress overall- but my fat hands had a tough time getting in and out of the sleeves!
Needed a cami underneath and the slit is very high if you need to sit down in a professional situation, but I can't get over the print. Very pretty and unique

links_reviews_title: I loved trying something different like this dress.
links_reviews_text: This fit very well overall. I agree with other reviewers that it does come open easily. It looks better standing than sitting only because it exposed quite a bit of cleavage when I sat. I would recommend using sticky tape to keep the top in place.

links_reviews_title: I didn't wear it, too tight.
links_reviews_text: Fit well, but the sleeves were too long.

This is a great dress. I felt almost comfortable in, but my hips wouldn't allow it in my conservative workplace. The wrap dress fit perfectly up top and even gave a fantastic shape in the rear, but with the slit I couldn't convince myself to wear it to work. Will rent again when I love a few :)

links_reviews_title: fully lined dress. too heavy of material for warm weather
links_reviews_text: heavy material, too formal

I wore this dress to work with pumps a similar shade of purple and I think I got the most compliments I've ever gotten. It's an easy flattering dress. A true wrap with a high slit though so just beware of wind. I would size down if you're in between sizes.

I listened to another reviewer who claimed the dress ran big and "swallowed" them. Really wish I hadn't taken their advice. The dress is very true to size. I'm typically a 10, sometimes an 8 and while the 8 fits and is fine, I think I would have loved this dress in a 10.

links_reviews_title: It was OK... not great ... not bad.
links_reviews_text: A part of me felt like this dress was a housecoat. I wore it but didn't love it.

links_reviews_title: Honestly I looked like I was wearing my grandmother's nightgown
links_reviews_text: Slit came VERY high up the middle/side. Wrinkled very easily
Super cute, tons of compliments - be aware of wind and the slit (probably not work appropriate)

links_reviews_title: Super comfortable and lots of compliments
links_reviews_text: The color was great for summer and everyone noticed it! Super comfortable fit but I didn't love the puffy shoulders so I rolled the sleeves up
The fit was great, but the sleeves on this dress make it feel and look very frumpy. Didn't end up wearing this one anywhere.
Great work dress but be careful, the slit in front opens very easily especially when walking

Fit was not good, and I'm not sure it would work for anyone as I think I actually had the right size. There is not enough fabric in the wrap around part of the skirt and the slit (going alll the way up) would have peaked out all the time.
Nice dress!

links_reviews_title: Super elegant cut, very feminine and comfortable.
links_reviews_text: Had to be a little careful walking due to the slit, it opens up pretty wide.

links_reviews_title: This dress looks so sleazy on- the slit is ridiculously high and the neck is also very low- NSFW
links_reviews_text: Cuta fabric, but awful fit overall
Gorgeous but beware windy days, has tendency to fly open and is quite revealing.
Slit to the crotch made this a no go for me!
Slit at leg is a little much
looks like pajama

This dress is gorgeous if you are standing still in it. I'm not sure if my larger lower half made this dress fit so strangely, but I was literally having to hold it to keep it from flapping open while walking/had to very carefully arrange it when I was sitting. The top had similar issues - was constantly making sure I had coverage. This dress is like a robe with one tie on the inside and one on the outside. It is a good length for work if you don't have issues with the "slit". The dress arrived in good condition.
so soft , people wanted to touch it and so many compliments. I want to buy this jacket !
I really liked this jacket but couldn't wear it because it was too large for me. The exterior is super soft and silky. If you're petite, this jacket may look overpowering since it's a bulky fit.
These are very delicate and dainty. The crystals are iridescent - Swarovski?
Light and easy to wear. Added nice style to my outfit. Would rent again

links_reviews_title: Nice cut but stretch out a lot- rec to size down
links_reviews_text: I rented these with the matching TT Banshee top. Made a great outfit and I got several compliments. Very slimming! I would order a size down in the pants next time. Worn once and sort of hanging on me. Back they go, but will likely rent again (sizing down).

These are not ordinary which is why I like them. The color is not a true navy - it is much brighter even though it is not reflected in this photo. The thick cuffs add some whimsy. The waist was big on me and there are no belt loops. The material is thick/warm so good for colder climates.

High quality, comfortable, perfect amount of stretch and perfect length. The slight flair of the cuffs is flattering for us ladies with shorter legs. The rise hits just below belly button. Beautiful deep blue color and actual pockets (hard to find in work slacks).
I wore these to work with the Sez Pintuck Blouse. Loved this outfit!

Love the fit of these. At 5'3 they hit just nearly to the floor with flats on, which I expect and usually choose pants that hit ankle length on the RTR model as they fit my stump legs perfectly as regular length pants. The cuffs at the bottom add a nice weight to the pants so that they hang really nicely. The material is really nice too - almost like crepe. Thick enough to smooth things out, thin enough for summer heat. For true to size. Wish I could keep these!

links_reviews_title: Great pants, looks just like photos
links_reviews_text: I loved these- very comfortable and stylish
Pants are beautiful! Great for petite gals. Collects SO MUCH lint! I was rolling all day. I did wear with a new tweed jacket, but it was crazy. Very flattering for curvy body type.

I really liked these pants for work! I am between a 4 and 6 depending on the make and cut. I rented the 6 and the waist as everyone said was a little big but I still wore them because there great for work.

I tend to size up in pants because the good Lord was handing out extra hips and booty on the day she made me, but this was a very bad idea. Pants were HUGE everywhere, from waist, to thigh, to calf. Stay true to size.

These pants were so so comfortable and fell right to my ankles (I am petite so it's always a treat to find pants which aren't too long). The large cuff made them a but odd, kind of like a half bell bottom, but they were so comfy I didn't even care. Definitely will rent another pair of TT pants.
Runs large with no belt loops! Nice pants, but couldn't wear.
Fit was great. Good for short people. Comfortable, with thicker fabric.
Pants are really soft, fitted but professional.
These were great ankle pants for work but they were enormous. I also warn that they don't have any belt loops. So I was pulling my pants up all day! I highly recommend sizing down.
These pants are top notch. The style and fit are perfect. I will definitely rent again for any work day and could definitely dress them up with a fancy jacket.
Great pants, but they were falling off me (I wore them anyway). Rented the matching top which makes a great outfit. Would rent again one size down. Very comfortable.
Cute pants but would definitely recommend sizing up if you have a booty.
To big in the waste. I couldn't wear these at all. I normally wear 2-4. I ordered a 2

links_reviews_title: Love these! The material is rich and lovely.
links_reviews_text: True to fit, the cuff is beautiful and tailored.
I like these but needed a larger size in this style vs other TT pants
Wore them a few times. Very nice fabric and comfortable fit. The fabric is a bit stretchy which made Them Easy to wear. It's a pretty heavy fabric. Great for the Fall weather.

links_reviews_title: Straight/boxy fit in hips and thighs
links_reviews_text: Good material with a slight flare - felt sturdy and wearable for a full day of work. Never got to wear them because the thighs were tight and the waist was small. Might be best suited for less hippy ladies.
Very comfortable but professional. Bottom cuffs add a nice detail.
Obsessed with these pants. Fabric is thick without being hot, the color is a vibrant navy blue. I'm 5'3 and this hit me right at the ankle.

Nice pants, but they run small and I couldn't wear. I'm usually between 4 and 6 but the 6 was really tight. Also they were a heavier weight than I expected. I might try again, ordering up a size, later when the weather cools down.
True to size, comfortable and flattering on. Classic style

links_reviews_title: Good fit everywhere besides the waist!
links_reviews_text: These were great and comfortable with a good fit around the butt and legs- however the waist was huge!
I was a bit excited about these because of the cuffs. Alas. Way too small. And they looked tired - the fabric is thick and textured- but my pair looked over-worn and needing a nap.
These were comfortable and cute. At 5'3" they hit me at ankle length, but did not look like a crop pant because of the cuff. The color is a bright navy. Will rent again

links_reviews_title: Fit true to size. Very comfortable!
links_reviews_text: Pants worked out great no issues.

links_reviews_title: Comfortable, but waist ran very big
links_reviews_text: The waist on these pants is very large. I would size down.
These jeans fit perfectly, however minus one star because they are tough to wear with ankle boots because of the side slits. It ends up looking sloppy.

links_reviews_title: Super flattering on my post partum bod!
links_reviews_text: I needed some temporary jeans as I am 2 months post partum and not my usual size. These were so nice to have and so flattering!

I wanted to love these. They're so tight. I wear a 33 or 32 and these 33's are very hard to close. They make my butt and thighs look nice but they're also a tad too long. I don't think I'm short so this was disappointing. Better with heels.

Loved the grey color. Very comfortable. Mid rise. I'm usually a 27-28 for jeans and was recommended a 29. The waist was much to large- should have ordered a 27. There is a lot of stretch and they do tend to lose their shape a bit by the end of the day.

links_reviews_title: Great fit for everyday casual jeans
links_reviews_text: These jeans fit like a glove for a tight fit. Great casual jeans
Great weekend jeans. Cute ankle detail, super flattering, great light black/grey color, and they keep their shape. Love them.

links_reviews_title: Really wanted to wear these, but the sizing was wonky.
links_reviews_text: Something was up with the sizing on these AG jeans. I own a pair of the Prima Ankles (31) in a different wash that are a little snug, so I ordered these a full 2 sizes up (33). They were snug at the waist, and when I compared them to the size 31 pair I own the waist was the exact same size.
Per some of the other reviews, I sized up. I liked the fit for the first wear, but the knees stretched out after that. Cool pair of jeans though, and I would rent again.
Cute jeans if you want gray. I already have my own gray jeans so I was bummed. I thought they would. be like a cool indigo.
These were unexpectedly low rise even though I avoided "high rise" listings. Maybe I'm just so used to high rise these days?

links_reviews_title: Couldn't wear it because so small
links_reviews_text: Unfortunately it was way smaller than I thought, so couldn't wear it. It seems that it needs to be at least a couple sizes up from your usual.
Love the shade of grey of these jeans. These jeans are nice and soft and they hit my ankle in the right spot.

links_reviews_title: So comfy and a nice shade of grey
links_reviews_text: fits well all around and surprisingly not too long for regular length
I wore these several times. The colors is Auchan nice blue gray.
These are great flattering jeans but very worn out so not for a fancy event. I wore them multiple times.
Flattering fit and cute jeans. As someone who wears lots of black tees this was perfect! Also I loved this with cozy fall sweaters!
tight but still stretchy. these are cropped just at the ankle.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful wash, longer & looser at the ankle than they look.
links_reviews_text: I thought these jeans were beautiful - the ankle was looser and hit lower than I expected based on my height/item description/my previous experience with this brand. Also felt that the waistband hit in an awkward place, but that's just a matter of finding the right fit for me.

links_reviews_title: So new tags still on! Sized slightly smaller.
links_reviews_text: Loved the jeans, ran smaller than my AG straight legged jeans and skinnies from other designers, same size.

Really soft and comfy! I would say these are a true mid-rise jean. I liked the distressed hem and slit towards the bottom of the jeans. The jeans were a little long for my taste. I prefer my jeans to hit above my ankle (like the model in the photo). These hit right below my ankle bone and I am 5'7. That was really my only complaint and it is really more of a personal preference.
It's a bit see-through, so you need to wear a slip or everyone will be able to see everything. It's absolutely gorgeous color and a very fun design. It made me happy. Runs big. Size down.

links_reviews_title: Fun pop of color to add to my work wardrobe
links_reviews_text: Got this in my RTR unlimited shipment in March and it was vibrant addition to my work wardrobe. The pink is pretty bright and the stripes are painted on instead of being more pleated like I thought. I wore it was ankle boots and the length was just right. Fabric was a bit heavy so it kept me warm. Would definitely rent again.
Sized up to a L for 32 week bump but could have worn my normal M. Cute dressed up or with T-shirt and sneakers for casual.
Great skirt for sight seeing in NY. It was 70-65 degrees that evening and the skirt felt just right to keep me cool and warm

It runs about a size big so I had to pin it to fit and it's knit so there's some sheerness between the panels, not a big deal but would've been good to know beforehand :) Overall I got a lot of compliments and it was comfortable all day!

links_reviews_title: Great skirt for church or work
links_reviews_text: Can dress it up or down

links_reviews_title: Great skirt; but runs too big!
links_reviews_text: Worn to a casual rehearsal dinner party. So cute but runs way big. Had already sized down and still needed to pin it up

The skirt is so cute but I wish it was like 5 inches shorter. I'm 5'3 so I'm definitely on the shorter side. Taller girls might like this shirt more. I was determined to wear this skirt though so I ended up hiking it up to my chest and it worked out pretty well!

I rented this for a date night but ended up wearing to work. I'm 130 lbs and 5'3 and the small fell on my hips so it was a bit longer than I anticipated. I dressed it WAY down but it would be great with heels. The fabric was light and breezy and I loved the way the skirt moved. It's more of a spring/summer fabric but overall I would totally recommend. The color alone makes it worth it.
Love it. Wore for work but this piece goes from office to a cocktail parry easily. My boyfriend did not like the fabric but I did! ;-)
Fun pop of color

links_reviews_title: I rented this skirt because the style of it is very cute!
links_reviews_text: I rented this skirt because the style of it is very cute! The sizes were a little strange... I ordered a XS and it fit like a M. I had to do a lot of pinning in order to wear it, even then it was still big but it worked for my look that day! It really is a beautiful skirt!
Great skirt. Wore it to work and for a family dinner. Very comfy. True to size.
Fun pop of color in winter wardrobe. Is 2-toned which was a surprise.

links_reviews_title: Loved all the ideas of this skirt--pleats, Length, color, split. They all work!
links_reviews_text: I wore the skirt with ankle boots. Can't wait try it with sneakers.

This skirt is a more special version of the average pleated A-line midi. The pleats are creating with different knitting stitches as opposed to pressing which helps to hold the skirt's shape. The pattern fades from light to darker pink to create the look of added dimension. And the slit makes it cool! One note... the waistband stretches with wear. If you have a smaller waist or prefer a snug fit, size down.

links_reviews_title: I wore it to my sister's 21st birthday party.
links_reviews_text: Super comfortable and flattering. A bit loose at my hips.

Derek has done it again, luxury and functionality all in one so I am pleased and happy to wear. loved this so much the first rental was too large, the 2nd there was damage, now this is my third and I am elated!

Absolutely loved this! I received so many compliments on it. The fabric is really unique, people kept asking if they could touch it. Definitely runs large. I wear a 6 - ordered the small and had no trouble zipping or wearing and it didn't look snug at all. The Slit is a perfect, ending just above the knee. A little sex appeal, while being professional and so dang cute.
Didn't end up wearing this. Was ultimately too long and a little big, felt too frumpy. Pretty color and cool style, just doesn't work for short gals!
Stretches

links_reviews_title: The waist was WAY too big to wear
links_reviews_text: Beautiful color and fabric, was really disappointed at how big it runs.

links_reviews_title: Runs at least 2 sizes too big
links_reviews_text: This is a gorgeous skirt, but I made the mistake of not reading the reviews beforehand. The size M could easily fit a 10-12, I ended up pinning it (because I didn't want to return without wearing and had a casual day at work anyway). Although a knit skirt, it was fairly lightweight and I have to imagine it would be a nice summer wear, just definitely size down if you order!!

links_reviews_title: I did not end up wearing, too large and did not look as expensive as expected.
links_reviews_text: Disappointed, really wanted to love this skirt. Was a little dumpy and too big, not nearly as glam as was hoping.
I'm very tall but I thought this was too long to wear. Made me look frumpy

The color of this skirt if amazing. Unfortunately, it ran very large, sat low on my hips which was very unflattering and I didn't even wear it because the small felt like it was falling off. Sizing seems to be off as it ran so large that it felt 2 sizes too big.
I so wish I could've worn this! I already sized down 1 size. If you want to wear it high waisted- size down 2 sizes.
I rented the large, as suggested, and the waist was about 4-5 inches too big so I didn't wear it.
It was longer than it looked in the picture, almost maxi length on me. Loved the color and the side slit.

links_reviews_title: A little less sharp than I expected
links_reviews_text: A little less sharp than I expected - the color grading was cool but the slit and the fabric made this less dressy than I wanted it to be for work. It was nice for a casual weekend outing in The daytime.
Metal latch on skirt on the size I received was broken. Very heavy material-- not great for summer. I wore this as a maternity skirt while 5 months pregnant.

Holy smokes - I can't believe more reviewers aren't talking about how this dress (Which retails for almost $500!) is completely and absolutely see-through! I rented it for work, but it'd be more useful as a sexy-see-through bikini cover-up at the beach! Yikes! I definitely regret renting this.
This color grabs people's attention for sure. I wore for work with a black Everlane turtle neck, tights, and ankle boots and received multiple compliments. Would definitely rent again!
I didn't end up wearing this because it was too big and not flattering.

The waist was the size of the skirt, so for people with small waists (me), it was not flattering. Would have to wear a big sweater to cover that but that is also not flattering for my body shape (hourglass).

Planned to wear at a baby shower. I am a true small and wear a 2 and sometimes 4 or 0, depending on the brand. I'm 5'6" and felt this ran large and also was a bit too long.. it was longer than midi on me and was at an awkward length. I have a pretty thin, straight build and it sat on my mid hips when I would've preferred a little higher waist. Wanted it to work.
Great quality but was unable to wear as it was too big. I ordered a medium and am 5'10 145lbs typical size 4/6
As others have noted, skirt runs big- also is see through... Wouldn't rent again
I have the same designer in an XS and it fits perfectly so not sure why the pink version is larger! Was going to wear to a Valentine's Party tomorrow night.
Size down super big in waist
Not my usual style, but fun for a one time rental. Wrinkles a little and is a little on the long/big side.
I wore this for walking around Epcot in Florida. Perfect warm weather vibe for the climate. Got some compliments and the material feels so nice and expensive! Looks good tied or untucked.

I liked this top a lot. It had silver fronds embroidered on the front and back shoulder area, as well as the word "Bonjour" embroidered in cyan between the shoulder blades. The top feels vaguely western inspired and is appropriate for work or for the weekend. The material is silky feeling and pleasant to wear.

Drapes very well and the fabric is the perfect weight to give a pulled together and casual look. Feels great on and the embroidery is wonderful. Wore this numerous times. It was French, Western, and modern all at once.

links_reviews_title: A very chic western bowling shirt
links_reviews_text: This shirt had way more western / bowling shirt details than I was expecting, but it was absolutely beautiful and extremely flattering. It has slots at the hip so it falls nicely without pulling, and you can choose to keep the bottom buttons open and tie it like the model pic (just a note that it isn't one of those shirts made for that though). Only downside is the amazing silk wrinkles immediately.
I would buy this if price point was better. I loved it. Really comfortable and felt trendy. I wore at least 5 times. I would have gone with small, but it wasn't available. Medium worked, but was big.

links_reviews_title: Love this shirt! Great quality and fit. Super cool
links_reviews_text: Great fabric and fantastic fit

links_reviews_title: Business in the front and party in the back
links_reviews_text: Super silky material that wrinkles a bit, but ended up tying it in the front most of the time to hide this fact. Got so many compliments and didn't want to send it back -- it's the perfect summer essential.
Over all fit was great a lot of these style shirts end up showing the side of my belly not this one! No unexposed skin. Material was so soft!
I really liked this top, could be worn tied or untied. The material is really high quality
Lovedddd this. Easy to take day to night and definitely a stand out shirt. The material is light and silky.

links_reviews_title: Absolutely in love with this shirt.
links_reviews_text: I would wear this shirt everyday. I styled it with leggings and jeans. Perfect shirt that makes me feel chic but casual.

I'm typically a medium but the large fit great. It's not form fitting so preferred as an open jacket/shirt. Heavy enough for 60's temp. Wore a coat over it for chillier weather. I'm 5'8 and this hit about mid thigh, taller in the torso. Loved this piece and would definitely wear again.
It's super long but can be tucked or tied

Love this shirt. I've worn it out to weekend brunch and will certainly be able to wear it to work. The material is so soft. The threading has shine to it so you can dress it up or down. It fits loose but you can tie it in the front if you want a tighter look.
So cute, got many compliments. Wore with all black and statement earrings. Cute to play around with tucking in

I'm not a fan of tying a knot in my shirts and it looked awkward just hanging full length on me as I'm on the shorter side. I found it difficult to tuck into jeans due to the length but it was easy to tuck into a black skirt. Wore with black tights and cute boots for a night of drinks. Warning that the buttons gapped as I moved and I'm small busted -- so wear a layer underneath if you plan to wear to work.
So cute!
great shirt and super soft
Nothing is better than 100% silk , great shirt easy to wear

links_reviews_title: Had to be photographed in this and it was very flattering
links_reviews_text: FIt perfectly

links_reviews_title: Cute top for every day or going out
links_reviews_text: Loved this tucked in with lighter jeans.
A really cute shirt, but be aware it does say 'bonjour' on the back! I sized up because I have a larger chest and arms, but it actually was quite large so I wish I had sized down.
You can wear this a bunch of different ways, it was so cute
So cute, touch of western but still dressy enough for work.

links_reviews_title: wore to work once and out for drinks again. really versatile
links_reviews_text: Super sleek, lightweight blouse that I got soo many compliments on! Runs a little big but that's my preferred fit for most tops.
Loose comfortable fit, the side skits are higher than I'd expect. I wore it tied in the front and the slits showed some skin around my waist.
Love this shirt. I wore it with the back tucked in and the front tied. It's a cute shirt with some flare that is not quite western, but would also pair nicely with a pair of boots.

I loved the quality and lay of the shirt. One of those pieces that transitions easily throughout the day. It wrinkled easily and the second time I wore it I regretted skipping the steamer. *My partner did say the shirt made me look like a cowboy.

links_reviews_title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this quirky, fun shirt!
links_reviews_text: Easily my favorite RTR to date-- it's a fun mix of LA and western style and I got a ton of compliments on it. Wore to work and then to happy hour. It's a beautifully light, silk shirt that I paired with jeans and snakeskin booties, with a french tuck in the front. I was so bummed because I told myself I would just buy it but then I saw the price. No matter, will definitely rent again!

links_reviews_title: Easygoing shirt with a bit of flair!
links_reviews_text: Definitely runs large - I am a size 6 or 8 and the small was just right.
Nice but more silky than I would have liked. Felt like a cowboy wanna be.
I wore a size too big, but it was the perfect "loose" fit. Wore the top with a pair of wide-leg Eileen Fisher pants. Was super comfy.

links_reviews_title: I absolutely love this shirt I would buy it !
links_reviews_text: versatile and many ways to wear . it's hip

this top is so fun, well fitting (I could have easily worn the small but the medium was the only size available), and a conversation starter. i would wear this out every night of the week if that was an option :)
Loved this top - easy to throw on with jeans and looks super chic.

links_reviews_title: Will daydream about this shirt until I order again.
links_reviews_text: So soft, so cool, so beginner's French-inspired. I normally wear a large, but as a busty lady, I leveled up to the XL so I could make sure it fit. Fit it did. So many compliments. I wore it tucked in one time and tied one time. Both looked real cute. I was trs sad when it came time to say au revoir.
This shirt is comfortable and fits like a dream. I'm rather busty but it hung really well. I usually can't pull off tomboy looks due to my curves but this looks fab!

links_reviews_title: Perfect for brunch and Sunday Funday!
links_reviews_text: I loved this jumper! I'm 5'3 so heels were a must, and mine were about 3 inches. I'm a size 0/XS/XXS and 105lbs so it did fit slightly loose, but not where I was uncomfortable or tugging at it. It is a thicker material and lined so no worries about anywhere being see through. I still wore it in the 100 degree humid Texas heat, and got a ton of compliments!

links_reviews_title: I loved that it was the perfect transitional piece from summer to fall in the Bay Area!
links_reviews_text: I loved pairing it with a jacket - So cute! I wish there was more stretch in it and I would say overall it ran small.

Fit great through waist and hips. Slightly wide leg. Perfect length for short girls. Lined which was nice since so many pants aren't lined. Top was a little big on me. A fuller bust or broader shoulders would enable the straps to stay out. Loved the side buttons. Wore this with a wide belt and without a belt. Really cute.
Beautiful white linen romper. Thick material that is SO flattering. Tons of compliments. Definitely will rent again.

I wore this to Napa on vacation and it was perfect for wine tastings. It is linen and light so wasn't too hot in the summer heat. I am 5'7" and it rode a little when I would sit down, but nothing too uncomfortable. I would imagine if you are any taller than that it would be too short in the middle. Overall a great summer look.
Relaxed fit yet is flattering. Lays very nicely!
This was too small to wear. I couldn't even zip it! I usually wear an 8 or a 10, and the 10 was too short and very very small. I think it could be cute but definitely size up one or two sizes.
This was really cute but I had to keep sizing up which I was surprised with. I am 5'1 and it fit me right above the ankles which I loved.

Unfortunately I was unable to wear this as it was short in the crotch and very unflattering. I have relatively short legs, and it was unflattering for that reason as well. I would suggest this for taller, more long-legged women.
This jumpsuit runs small
Too small
Bottom is loose but torso was super tight. Too hard to zip up alone.
Really wanted to like this jumpsuit, but was way too small for my height! It rode up in the crotch and was very uncomfortable. I am not tall, but this definitely didn't work for my body.

i'm typically a 2 and this fit perfect. there isn't a lot of stretch so size up if you're btwn sizes and busty. no bra needed, love the pockets. i'm short so this looks best w a small heel. easy to use the bathroom in. not see through or too hot for summer. love everything about this
Very short waisted on my 5'10 frame, had to send back without wearing.

links_reviews_title: Way too short in the rise and quite thick.
links_reviews_text: I ordered up a size because it was the only size available and it was large on top. Even in my usual size though this wouldn't have worked. It was super short in the rise. I'm tall but find 8/10 jumpsuits fit me since more of my height comes from my legs. This jumpsuit was lined and quite thick, which is great for hiding flaws and undergarments but I imagine it would be uncomfortable on a hot day.
Now that I have a child, I can't wear anything without pockets. Sad but true.
Very comfortable and well made
Just doesn't fit right. Too wide leg and not flattering.

I sized up since I am curvy and sometimes in between sizes but it still didn't look right on me. It wasn't trendy baggy nor did it go in at the waist. It was very boxy, tight in the crotch though I have a short torso and shapeless. It just didn't fit me.

links_reviews_title: Too Long for Skirt - Made It a Summer Dress
links_reviews_text: Rented this and matching top for dressy casual day quarantining with my in laws and kids. Skirt was long- on my 5'5 frame it went down to my ankles! It fun pulled up to as a dress and worn out on warm night

I loved these pants and got a ton of compliments! They are a thicker material and totally work for a winter white. They could also be worn in warmer months but I love the winter white look. The only issue is how tight the waist band is. I have wider hips and a smaller waist and this waist was so small I literally had to unbutton the waist when I sat down in my car. I ordered the size 8 (I originally had the 6) thinking that would help but the 8 had the same size waist.

links_reviews_title: Highest quality white pants I've ever worn
links_reviews_text: Normally white pants are somewhat see through but these are perfect. Thick and great quality and tried to show the cute slit on the inner parts of the cuff that is a unique touch! Pants are not stretchy at the waist, but so comfortable!

links_reviews_title: YES! Super cute and so many ways to wear them.
links_reviews_text: I rented these for work and possibly a convention I was attending. The pants are very heavy and look great. The butt and hips are a little loose for a straighter figure but it worked. I ended up not traveling with them due to the fact that I have a small carry-on and the thicker material took up too much space. But I will rent again for work.
I rented these pants along with the matching blazer. I'm 5 10" and the crop of the pants were the perfect length. They are versatile and can go from business casual to drinks/dinner.

Rented these to dress up the blazer for a more formal client meeting - really loved the weight of the pants for winter white. Gave me the confident look I wanted to match my prep work for the presentation I was giving. Total boss pants. #roomforbooty

Not the most flattering photo- these are way better with heels but wasn't feeling it today. The fabric is actually quite thick, and they do run a bit large. I have no business fitting in a size 4 pant, but do with these!

The moment I put these on, I thought "meh, not for me", especially because the booty was form fitting and I didn't know if I had a pair of underwear that wouldn't show lines through.
